<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-82] [validator] Error Message &apos;{field} is not in the range null through null&apos; in validator framework</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-82</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I am using struts 1.2.8. We are using the jar files from the Struts-Blank.war &lt;br/&gt;
provided at the apache site. We are using the validator framework for &lt;br/&gt;
performing the client &amp;amp; Server validations. When I use the &apos;intRange&apos; &lt;br/&gt;
or &apos;minlength&apos;. It performs the validations correctly but it displays incorrect &lt;br/&gt;
message as &apos;Test is not in the range null through null&apos; or &apos;Test2 can not be &lt;br/&gt;
less than null characters.&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Partial Code in the validator.xml file&lt;br/&gt;
--------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;!--  Test for Required &amp;amp; valid integers only and within the specifed &lt;br/&gt;
range --&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;field&lt;br/&gt;
            property=&quot;test&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            depends=&quot;required,integer,intRange&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;billForm.test&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;arg1&lt;br/&gt;
                key=&quot;${var:min}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                name=&quot;intRange&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;arg2&lt;br/&gt;
                key=&quot;${var:max}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                name=&quot;intRange&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;min&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;10&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;max&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;50&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            &amp;lt;!--  Test2 for Required &amp;amp; minimum length --&amp;gt;   &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            &amp;lt;field property=&quot;test2&quot; depends=&quot;required,minlength&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;billForm.test&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;arg1 key=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;minlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;3&amp;lt;/var-&lt;br/&gt;
value&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Partial Code in validitor-rules.xml&lt;br/&gt;
-----------------------------&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;      &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;required&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            classname=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.FieldChecks&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
               method=&quot;validateRequired&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
         methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Field,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.struts.action.ActionMessages,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Validator,&lt;br/&gt;
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  msg=&quot;errors.required&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;minlength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            classname=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.FieldChecks&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
               method=&quot;validateMinLength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
         methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Field,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.struts.action.ActionMessages,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Validator,&lt;br/&gt;
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
              depends=&quot;&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  msg=&quot;errors.minlength&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;jsFunction=&quot;org.apache.commons.validator.javascript.validateMinLength&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;      &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;intRange&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            classname=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.FieldChecks&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
               method=&quot;validateIntRange&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
         methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Field,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.struts.action.ActionMessages,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Validator,&lt;br/&gt;
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
              depends=&quot;integer&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  msg=&quot;errors.range&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Partial View Source Code of HTML/Javascript generated&lt;br/&gt;
======================================================&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    function EmpApproBillFormBean_intRange () &lt;/p&gt;
{ 
     this.a0 = new Array(&quot;test&quot;, &quot;Test is not in the range null through null.&quot;, 
new Function (&quot;varName&quot;, &quot;this.min=&apos;10&apos;; this.max=&apos;50&apos;;  return this
[varName];&quot;));
    }

&lt;p&gt;Please let me know why does the msg display &apos;null through null&apos;, instead of &apos;10 &lt;br/&gt;
through 50&apos;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards,&lt;br/&gt;
Yugandhar&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Sun&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

                            <comment id="12411468" author="niallp" created="Fri, 17 Feb 2006 06:25:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I can&apos;t see anything wrong with what you have, but this is really a question &lt;br/&gt;
for the struts user list. Please can you post your questions there and only &lt;br/&gt;
open bugzilla tickets when you you&apos;re convinced its a bug - rather than to get &lt;br/&gt;
help debugging your application.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The struts examples webapp has a working example of the integer range &lt;br/&gt;
validation (struts-example.war in the binary distribution) - select the &quot;Type &lt;br/&gt;
Form&quot; on the &quot;Validator Examples&quot; page and the &quot;Integer Field&quot; has a range &lt;br/&gt;
check. Maybe that will help you find out whats going wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Closing as INVALID.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12411469" author="reddy.yugandhar@gmail.com" created="Sat, 18 Feb 2006 03:19:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Niall,&lt;br/&gt;
         Thanks that struts example helped me. The position attribute solved &lt;br/&gt;
the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12411470" author="christian@aliosoft.com" created="Thu, 9 Mar 2006 00:55:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think this should still be considered a bug!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Using the new position attribute fixes the problem but arg0-arg3 should work too!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There&apos;s not even a word about the &quot;position&quot; attribute in Struts Validator Guide: &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://struts.apache.org//struts-doc-1.2.8/userGuide/dev_validator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://struts.apache.org//struts-doc-1.2.8/userGuide/dev_validator.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12411471" author="niallp" created="Thu, 9 Mar 2006 08:28:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #3)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; I think this should still be considered a bug!&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Using the new position attribute fixes the problem but arg0-arg3 should work&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; too! &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If arg0-arg3 doesn&apos;t work then I agree its a bug, but at the time it wasn&apos;t &lt;br/&gt;
clear to me that it was. I&apos;ve tried arg0-arg3 with the intRange validator in &lt;br/&gt;
Struts 1.2.8 and it works fine (using Validator 1.1.4). Having said that, a bug &lt;br/&gt;
was reported recently with Validator 1.2.0 and arg0-arg3 (see &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-20&quot; title=&quot;[validator] validator argument - resource=&amp;quot;false&amp;quot; ignored&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-20&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-2790&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;). If &lt;br/&gt;
Yugandhar was using version 1.2.0, then it was probably the cause of the &lt;br/&gt;
problem and that has now been fixed and should be available in the next &lt;br/&gt;
validator release (1.2.1).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt; There&apos;s not even a word about the &quot;position&quot; attribute in Struts&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Validator Guide: &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;a href=&quot;http://struts.apache.org//struts-doc-1.2.8/userGuide/dev_validator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://struts.apache.org//struts-doc-1.2.8/userGuide/dev_validator.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;True the struts user guide needs updating, patches are always welcome.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-81] [validator] JS Validation fails on CSS hidden elements.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-81</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;PROBLEM:&lt;br/&gt;
I am working on a web-app that has &quot;flip-book&quot; navigation, where multiple&lt;br/&gt;
fieldsets within a large form are shown/hidden determined by the tab selected.&lt;br/&gt;
JavaScript manages the navigation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When our form is submitted, the client-side JavaScript bombs when it tries to&lt;br/&gt;
set focus to the first invalid field (missing required, not an integer, etc.)&lt;br/&gt;
which is also CSS hidden. JavaScript cannot set focus on a field that is hidden.&lt;br/&gt;
Internet Explorer generates this message: &quot;Cannot move focus to the control&lt;br/&gt;
because it is invisible, not enabled, or of a type that does not accept the focus.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is the offending code in all the validateXXX JS methods:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        if (fields.length &amp;gt; 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
           focusField.focus();
           alert(fields.join(&apos;\n&apos;));
        }

&lt;p&gt;POSSIBLE RESOLUTION:&lt;br/&gt;
Only set focus if &quot;focusField.style.visibility&quot; is not &quot;hidden&quot; &amp;#8211; since CSS can&lt;br/&gt;
be used to hide elements.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tested using Commons Validator 1.1.3 with Struts 1.2.4&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341910">VALIDATOR-81</key>
            <summary>[validator] JS Validation fails on CSS hidden elements.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="paul_benedict@merck.com">Paul Benedict</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 2 Dec 2004 04:09:49 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:09 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:09 +0000</resolved>

                            <comment id="12408222" author="mpb@ntsource.com" created="Thu, 2 Dec 2004 04:34:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This has already been reported.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;

	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12408223" author="niallp" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 02:06:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have re-factored the &quot;error handling&quot; into a separate method, including &lt;br/&gt;
setting focus on the field which now ignores &apos;hidden&apos; type fields and fields &lt;br/&gt;
hidden using CSS.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367050&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367050&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This should be available in the next nightly build to test out (i.e. one dated &lt;br/&gt;
9th Jan or later):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Closing as FIXED.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-80] [validator] All validation fails when &quot;name&quot; attribute in form not specified</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-80</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;All validation fails when &quot;name&quot; attribute in a &amp;lt;form&amp;gt; is not specified.  If &lt;br/&gt;
a &quot;name&quot; attribute is not specified, the JavaScript should query the &quot;id&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
property&apos;s value as it is legal for the &quot;id&quot; to be specified with the &quot;name&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
left out (XHTML Strict).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An example of this problem coming up is when the &amp;lt;html:xhtml/&amp;gt; is specified &lt;br/&gt;
when using Struts.  See All validation fails when &quot;name&quot; attribute in a &amp;lt;form&amp;gt; is not specified.  If &lt;br/&gt;
a &quot;name&quot; attribute is not specified, the JavaScript should query the &quot;id&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
property&apos;s value as it is legal for the &quot;id&quot; to be specified with the &quot;name&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
left out (XHTML Strict).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An example of this problem coming up is when the &amp;lt;html:xhtml/&amp;gt; is specified &lt;br/&gt;
when using Struts.  See Bug 35127.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A patch fixing this problem is supplied.  It checks the id attribute if the &lt;br/&gt;
name attribute is not specified..&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A patch fixing this problem is supplied.  It checks the id attribute if the &lt;br/&gt;
name attribute is not specified.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342297">VALIDATOR-80</key>
            <summary>[validator] All validation fails when &quot;name&quot; attribute in form not specified</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-79] Emailvalidation doesn&apos;t accept umlauts and the new generic top level domain names</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-79</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hello&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We&apos;re registering a problem with the built in email validation in the validator&lt;br/&gt;
framework. The problem an be split up in two pieces:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;1. the validation rejects email addresses with umlauts like&lt;br/&gt;
peter.m&#195;&#188;ller@freesurf.ch. The use of umlauts in a domain name ist allowed (so&lt;br/&gt;
called idn&apos;s, Internationalized Domain Names, see rfc 3454, 3490, 3491, 3492)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2. the validation rejects email addresses with generic toplevel domain names&lt;br/&gt;
like .info, sample: peter.sample@sample.info will be rejectet by email validation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For us, it&apos;s a little bit a show stopper, because our applications addresses&lt;br/&gt;
customers in europe, where practically every native language has umlauts, and we&lt;br/&gt;
have also clients who can&apos;t register in our applications because they have .info&lt;br/&gt;
as toplevel domain.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Linux&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341537">VALIDATOR-79</key>
            <summary>Emailvalidation doesn&apos;t accept umlauts and the new generic top level domain names</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="5">Cannot Reproduce</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="mantra@freesurf.ch">Peter Feuz</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 24 Jun 2004 23:26:13 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12406916" author="germuska" created="Thu, 24 Jun 2004 23:36:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is not a Struts bug, it&apos;s a commons-validator bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that the commons-validator XML configuration permits you to specify your own validation &lt;br/&gt;
javascript, overriding the defaults.  Because of this, I&apos;m changing the severity to &quot;minor&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you happen to come up with a work-around that you use in that way, perhaps you could also attach it &lt;br/&gt;
to this bug ticket to make it easier for someone to correct the issue in the source javascript.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406917" author="tkurosaka" created="Fri, 25 Jun 2004 00:43:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Despite the acceptance of IDN, email address format is still governed by&lt;br/&gt;
RFC 821&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc0821.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc0821.txt&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
and it requires an email address (&quot;mailbox&quot;) composed of strictly ASCII&lt;br/&gt;
characters only.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also note that the IDN only addresses the domain name portion.  It does not&lt;br/&gt;
apply to the user id portion of the email address of user@domain. &lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12406918" author="martinc" created="Fri, 25 Jun 2004 11:17:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Actually, RFC 821 has been obsoleted by RFC 2821, but essentially you&apos;re right, &lt;br/&gt;
the domain name restrictions have not been extended to allow for IDN in e-mail &lt;br/&gt;
addresses.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406919" author="mrdon" created="Fri, 25 Jun 2004 11:20:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As for problem number 2, the email validator javascript has already been &lt;br/&gt;
patched to support domain names that contain more than three characters.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406920" author="mantra@freesurf.ch" created="Fri, 25 Jun 2004 18:07:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;thanks for the informations. looking for the patch for domain names that contain&lt;br/&gt;
more than three characters as Don Brown said in  the commons-validator cvs&lt;br/&gt;
repository.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;so, i&apos;m closing this bug, thank you all.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-77] [validator] DTD incorrectly requires (field)+ for a derived form should be (field)*</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-77</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We have several forms that are named differently, but are the same, so we now&lt;br/&gt;
use &quot;extends&quot; rather than duplicate the configuration.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This should work&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;form name=&quot;specificForm&quot; extends=&quot;genericForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Instead we get: &lt;br/&gt;
    The content of element type &quot;form&quot; is incomplete, it must match &quot;(field)+&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Solution: DTD should allow (field)* within form element.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342810">VALIDATOR-77</key>
            <summary>[validator] DTD incorrectly requires (field)+ for a derived form should be (field)*</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="neale@nealeupstone.com">Neale</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 20 Dec 2005 22:53:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.2.0 Release</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12411101" author="niallp" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 08:08:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is now fixed in (new) validator_1_2_1.dtd.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367118&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367118&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Will be available in the next nightly build:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-76] [validator] ValidatorResourcesInitializer missing</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-76</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: &lt;br/&gt;
org/apache/commons/validator/ValidatorResourcesInitializer&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;using JDK 5.0 Update 6&lt;br/&gt;
Tomcat 5.5&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It was said that ValidatorResources will know how to initialize but it doesnt &lt;br/&gt;
seem so.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please help out.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows 2000&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342801">VALIDATOR-76</key>
            <summary>[validator] ValidatorResourcesInitializer missing</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="prashant.ladha@gmail.com">Prashant Ladha</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 18 Dec 2005 01:35:42 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12411082" author="rahul@apache.org" created="Sun, 18 Dec 2005 05:22:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As you mention, ValidatorResourcesInitializer was deprecated in 1.1.0 (alpha), &lt;br/&gt;
the specific entry in revision history is here:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/changes-report.html#1_1_0__alpha_&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/changes-report.html#1_1_0__alpha_&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For 1.2.0, as an example, you can eliminate calls to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ValidatorResourcesInitializer.initialize(ValidatorResources, InputStream)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;by replacing the no argument constructor of ValidatorResources with the &lt;br/&gt;
constructor that takes an InputStream argument.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The commons-user mailing list is more appropriate for ClassNotFoundException &lt;br/&gt;
style questions, please ask there before filing a bug.&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12411083" author="rahul@apache.org" created="Sun, 18 Dec 2005 05:23:34 +0000"  >&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-102&quot; title=&quot;[validator] ValidatorResourcesInitializer missing&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-102&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-2650&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***&lt;/li&gt;

	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-75] [Validator] validation breaks on multiple validation.xml (eg. with Struts 1.3)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-75</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;While bringing an app to a recent build (0909) of struts 1.3 and&lt;br/&gt;
commons-validator-1.2.0, I notice the following related to ValidatorPlugIn:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When using multiple validation files, as in:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;plug-in clasname=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.ValidatorPlugIn&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;set-property property=&quot;pathnames&quot;  &lt;br/&gt;
value=&quot;/WEB-INF/lib/validator-rules.xml,/WEB-INF/moduleA/validationA.xml,/WEB-INF/moduleB/validationB.xml&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/plug-in&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I get in the tomcat console:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;WARN Overriding FormSet definition. Duplicate for locale: fr&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Result is that validation rules on moduleA are not working.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I suspect  the message is because both validationA.xml and validationB.xml have&lt;br/&gt;
a &amp;lt;formset language=&quot;fr&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We used to be able to have one validationX.xml per module without problems.&lt;br/&gt;
(Having the bundle attribute since struts 1.2x made that even better, so there&lt;br/&gt;
could be one resource-file per module).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I see that now commons-validator 1.2 seems to change this. I fear that without a&lt;br/&gt;
fix I would have to go back to validations for 400 screens in one single&lt;br/&gt;
validationABCDEF...xml.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It looks like commons-validation 1.2 implementation builds a formset key based&lt;br/&gt;
on language, country and variant, but doesn&apos;t seem to merge formsets any more.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If my analysis is correct, my suggestion would be&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;to either have commons-validator continue to merge formsets for  backward&lt;br/&gt;
compatibility, and/or,&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;add a namespace or id parameter as in &amp;lt;formset id=&quot;moduleA&quot; language=&quot;fr&quot;&amp;gt;, if&lt;br/&gt;
necessary to keep the &quot;physical map&quot; feature.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342595">VALIDATOR-75</key>
            <summary>[Validator] validation breaks on multiple validation.xml (eg. with Struts 1.3)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                                <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="wgehner@infonoia.com">Wolfgang Gehner</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 4 Oct 2005 01:09:47 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.2.0 Release</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12410518" author="niallp" created="Tue, 4 Oct 2005 01:21:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Additional info for reference:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Struts dev list thread:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;   &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.mail-archive.com/dev%40struts.apache.org/msg12395.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.mail-archive.com/dev%40struts.apache.org/msg12395.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Looks like this issue is caused by the following change to ValidatorResources:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;   &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=264683&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=264683&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12410519" author="mrdon" created="Tue, 4 Oct 2005 02:54:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ok, it looks like the solution would just be to merge the formsets instead of&lt;br/&gt;
requiring them to be defined one.  That, or we should modify the buildKey&lt;br/&gt;
function to produce unique ids.  Am I missing something?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410520" author="niallp" created="Tue, 4 Oct 2005 04:28:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #2)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Ok, it looks like the solution would just be to merge the formsets instead of&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; requiring them to be defined one.  That, or we should modify the buildKey&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; function to produce unique ids.  Am I missing something?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I agree merging the formsets is the best approach.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The old way it used to work (before revision 264683) has the flaw that if a &lt;br/&gt;
form with the same name is defined in two different validation files (for the &lt;br/&gt;
same locale) - then it would only ever pick up the first one it came to. If we &lt;br/&gt;
merge the formsets, then any duplicates can be detected and logged as errors &lt;br/&gt;
which is much better IMO.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m assigning this to myself and will change it later tonight - is that OK with &lt;br/&gt;
you Don?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410521" author="niallp" created="Wed, 5 Oct 2005 10:47:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is now fixed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Should be available in the nightly build. Also, if you&apos;re using the struts &lt;br/&gt;
build for 1.3.0 - the validator-SNAPSHOT jar has been updated.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have also updated the struts-examples webapp - it now merges several &lt;br/&gt;
validation.xml files in the same modules.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-74] &quot;depends&quot; property of the &quot;validator&quot; element is ignored</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-74</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The validator element in the validator-rules.xml file has a &quot;depends&quot; property, &lt;br/&gt;
which seems to indicate validations that are preconditions to the current &lt;br/&gt;
validation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example, the following definition from the &quot;email&quot; validator seems to &lt;br/&gt;
indicate that a precondition for a field being a valid email address is that &lt;br/&gt;
the field be &quot;required&quot; (i.e. non-null and non-empty).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;      &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;email&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            classname=&quot;org.apache.struts.util.StrutsValidator&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
               method=&quot;validateEmail&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
         methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Field,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors,&lt;br/&gt;
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
              depends=&quot;required&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  msg=&quot;errors.email&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;With this apparent behavior, I should be able to define a field in my &lt;br/&gt;
validation.xml as:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            &amp;lt;field property=&quot;login&quot; depends=&quot;email&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;prompt.login&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, this doesn&apos;t work. To get it to work, you must explicitly add &lt;br/&gt;
the &quot;required&quot; validation to the field&apos;s depends propery.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            &amp;lt;field property=&quot;login&quot; depends=&quot;required,email&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;prompt.login&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
            &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I have to add &quot;required&quot; to the field myself, what is the purpose of &lt;br/&gt;
the &quot;depends&quot; property of the validator element?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340561">VALIDATOR-74</key>
            <summary>&quot;depends&quot; property of the &quot;validator&quot; element is ignored</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="steve.stair@rrc.state.tx.us">Steve Stair</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 20 Feb 2003 03:32:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403674" author="dgraham1980@hotmail.com" created="Thu, 20 Feb 2003 03:59:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looks like a commons-validator issue...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403675" author="husted@apache.org" created="Mon, 17 Mar 2003 04:41:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Orginally, there was an implicit requires behind each validator. But that didn&apos;t&lt;br/&gt;
allow for people to say &quot;if (and only if) they enter an email address, make sure&lt;br/&gt;
it&apos;s in the proper format, but null is OK too.&quot; So, the requires was recently&lt;br/&gt;
made explicit. (And is documented as such in the Validator Developers Guide.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The purpose of the depends property is to list which validators are to be&lt;br/&gt;
applied to the field. The real issue might be the term &quot;depends&quot;. Perhaps it&lt;br/&gt;
should be something like &quot;validator&quot; or &quot;uses&quot; instead. &lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12403676" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Mon, 17 Mar 2003 08:27:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This bug is referring to the &amp;lt;validator depends=&quot;&quot;&amp;gt; attribute, not the &amp;lt;field &lt;br/&gt;
depends=&quot;&quot;&amp;gt; attribute.  The DTD allows for a depends attribute on the validator &lt;br/&gt;
element which allows validators to leverage the work of other validators &lt;br/&gt;
globally instead of at the field level.  This seems to be supported in the &lt;br/&gt;
Validator.validateFieldForRule() method but apparently isn&apos;t working.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403677" author="steve.stair@rrc.state.tx.us" created="Tue, 18 Mar 2003 00:24:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This seems to be working now with Struts 1.1-rc1&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403678" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 18 Mar 2003 01:17:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Cool, I don&apos;t have to spend any more time on it then &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-73] [validator] validateRequired.js uses unsupported DOM method for validation.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-73</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;validateRequired() method relies on the DOM method document.getAttributeNode()&lt;br/&gt;
for retrieving a form&apos;s &quot;name&quot; attribute value. document.getAttributeNode() is&lt;br/&gt;
not supported by Internet Explorer 5.5 or earlier and breaks the validation&lt;br/&gt;
routine. Patch uses better supported document.getAttribute().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: While this patch is for validateRequired.js only,&lt;br/&gt;
document.getAttributeNode() is also present in:&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateFloatRange.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateShort.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMinLength.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateDate.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateEmail.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateByte.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateIntRange.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMask.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateCreditCard.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateInteger.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMaxLength.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateFloat.js&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Index:&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateRequired.js&lt;br/&gt;
===================================================================&lt;br/&gt;
RCS file:&lt;br/&gt;
/home/cvspublic/jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateRequired.js,v&lt;br/&gt;

+++&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateRequired.js&lt;br/&gt;
     4 Oct 2004 22:00:58 -0000&lt;br/&gt;
@@ -12,9 +12,9 @@&lt;br/&gt;
         var focusField = null;&lt;br/&gt;
         var i = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
         var fields = new Array();&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;var formName = form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
+        var formName = form.getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;);&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + formName.value + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;br/&gt;
+        oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + formName + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;         for (x in oRequired) {&lt;br/&gt;
             var field = form[oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;];&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

&amp;gt;not supported by Internet Explorer 5.5 or earlier and breaks the validation&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So IMO still struts will not work on ie 5.5 and this bug should remain open &lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-72] The bundle-Attribute of the arg-Tag seems to have a Bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-72</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hello,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i have a Problem to switch the Bundle in the arg-Tag of the validation.xml &lt;br/&gt;
File always the default Resourcebundle is used to match the key-Attribute.&lt;br/&gt;
The bundle-Attribute of the msg-Tag has no Problems&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Following Code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;struts-config.xml&lt;br/&gt;
-----------------&lt;br/&gt;
.....&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;message-resources parameter=&quot;resources.master&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;message-resources key=&quot;phonebook&quot; parameter=&quot;resources.phonebook&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
.....&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;resources/phonebook.properties&lt;br/&gt;
------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
....&lt;br/&gt;
errors.required=&lt;/p&gt;
{0}
&lt;p&gt; is required.&lt;br/&gt;
phonebook.jsp.searchfor=&apos;Search for&apos; entry&lt;br/&gt;
....&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;validation.xml&lt;br/&gt;
-------------&lt;br/&gt;
.....&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;global/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;formset&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;form name=&quot;phonebookForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;field property=&quot;telQueryValue&quot; depends=&quot;required&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	  &amp;lt;msg name=&quot;required&quot; key=&quot;errors.required&quot; bundle=&quot;phonebook&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	  &amp;lt;arg position=&quot;0&quot; name=&quot;required&quot; key=&quot;phonebook.jsp.searchfor&quot;  &lt;br/&gt;
               bundle=&quot;phonebook&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
     &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;/formset&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
.....&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Following happens if the validator finds an error.&lt;br/&gt;
the &quot;errors.required&quot; key is translated, but the &quot;phonebook.jsp.searchfor&quot; key &lt;br/&gt;
is not translated, only if I put the key value-pair in the master.properties &lt;br/&gt;
File. Did anybody have an idea ? I use Validator 1.1.3, but also the &lt;br/&gt;
nightlybuild 1.2.0 seems to did not work. I found nothing in the web &lt;br/&gt;
describing this Problem. So could anyone help.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks Jens&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341897">VALIDATOR-72</key>
            <summary>The bundle-Attribute of the arg-Tag seems to have a Bug</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jens.selders@mgi.de">Jens Selders</reporter>

                            <comment id="12408187" author="niallp" created="Fri, 26 Nov 2004 18:21:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Currently bundle is ignored - there isn&apos;t a version yet, that fixes this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It has already been reported in Currently bundle is ignored - there isn&apos;t a version yet, that fixes this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It has already been reported in Bug 21760 and there is a patch waiting to go &lt;br/&gt;
into Struts to resolve this, but that patch is dependant on some changes in &lt;br/&gt;
Commons Validator - those have been done and were just waiting for a &quot;GA&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
quality release of Validator 1.1.4 (its being voted on as we speak) so that we &lt;br/&gt;
can move the Struts dependency to 1.1.4 and then appply the fix.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I&apos;m closing this as a duplciate of Bug 21760.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Niall&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 21760 *** and there is a patch waiting to go&lt;br/&gt;
into Struts to resolve this, but that patch is dependant on some changes in &lt;br/&gt;
Commons Validator - those have been done and were just waiting for a &quot;GA&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
quality release of Validator 1.1.4 (its being voted on as we speak) so that we &lt;br/&gt;
can move the Struts dependency to 1.1.4 and then appply the fix.&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;So I&apos;m closing this as a duplciate of Currently bundle is ignored - there isn&apos;t a version yet, that fixes this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It has already been reported in Bug 21760 and there is a patch waiting to go &lt;br/&gt;
into Struts to resolve this, but that patch is dependant on some changes in &lt;br/&gt;
Commons Validator - those have been done and were just waiting for a &quot;GA&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
quality release of Validator 1.1.4 (its being voted on as we speak) so that we &lt;br/&gt;
can move the Struts dependency to 1.1.4 and then appply the fix.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I&apos;m closing this as a duplciate of Bug 21760.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Niall&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 21760 ***.&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-71] [validator] validateDate cannot handle exception</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-71</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I make the defination in validation.xml as follows:&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;field property=&quot;Date&quot; depends=&quot;date&quot;&amp;gt;        &lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;date&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot; /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	    &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;datePattern&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	    &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;yyyy/MM/dd&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
While the value of property equals &quot;2005/06/1t&quot;, it shows that this value is&lt;br/&gt;
passed. I found in the source code of validateDate(...) that there&apos;s a function&lt;br/&gt;
named GenericTypeValidator.formatDate. So I maked a test:&lt;br/&gt;
----------------------------------------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
  Date result = GenericTypeValidator.formatDate(&quot;2005/06/1t&quot;, &quot;yyyy/MM/dd&quot;, false);&lt;br/&gt;
  System.out.println(result);&lt;br/&gt;
-----------------------------------------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
then I got the result: Wed Jun 01 00:00:00 CST 2005&lt;br/&gt;
There&apos;re no exceptions and the result is also valued, so validateDate(...)&lt;br/&gt;
returns Boolean.TRUE. I think the problem is in&lt;br/&gt;
GenericTypeValidator.formatDate(...).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342331">VALIDATOR-71</key>
            <summary>[validator] validateDate cannot handle exception</summary>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-69] support for indexed field validation</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-69</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Validation framework supports nested indexed field validation but not &lt;br/&gt;
validating indexed fields on the form. This does not allow me to have a list of &lt;br/&gt;
strings on my form unless I use another bean to hold it. Here are some minor &lt;br/&gt;
changes to validator classes to allow this functionality by supplying an empty &lt;br/&gt;
or no property field.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;field property=&quot;&quot; indexedProperty=&quot;referenceNumber&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                indexedListProperty=&quot;referenceNumbers&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                depends=&quot;integer,integerRange&quot;.......&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Changes to Form.addField&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    /**&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Add a &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;Field&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;Form&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.&lt;br/&gt;
    */&lt;br/&gt;
    public void addField(Field f) {&lt;br/&gt;
       if (f != null ) 
&lt;div class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;Unknown macro: {          String key = f.getProperty().trim();          if ((key==null) || (key.length()== 0)) {
            if (f.isIndexed())
              key = f.indexedListProperty;
            else
              return;
          }       	  lFields.add(f);          hFields.put(key, f);        }&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Changes to Field.generateKey()&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;/**&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Generate correct &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;key&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; value.&lt;br/&gt;
    */&lt;br/&gt;
    public void generateKey() 
&lt;div class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;Unknown macro: {       if (isIndexed()) {
          if ((property != null) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (property.length() &amp;gt;0))
            key = indexedListProperty + TOKEN_INDEXED + &quot;.&quot; + property;
          else
            key = indexedListProperty + TOKEN_INDEXED ;
       } else {
          key = property;
       }    }&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340389">VALIDATOR-69</key>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-68] ValidatorResources.get-method not working properly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-68</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The get-method in the ValidatorResources is not working properly as it returns &lt;br/&gt;
always null if the exact combination of language, country and variant is not &lt;br/&gt;
found in the formset-declaration of the validation.xml. I expected it to work &lt;br/&gt;
like the struts PropertyMessageResource class trying to retrieve first the most &lt;br/&gt;
specific formset and at last retrieving the most general formset.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340406">VALIDATOR-68</key>
            <summary>ValidatorResources.get-method not working properly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="bmoritz@gmx.de">Bj&#246;rn-H. Moritz</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 8 Nov 2002 20:05:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:07 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 19 Jul 2006 14:11:07 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0 (alpha)</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>2</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403194" author="bmoritz@gmx.de" created="Fri, 8 Nov 2002 21:08:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=3774)&lt;br/&gt;
Patch of the get-method&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403195" author="bmoritz@gmx.de" created="Fri, 8 Nov 2002 21:09:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=3775)&lt;br/&gt;
Patch of the get-method&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403196" author="mike.wilcox@aepona.com" created="Fri, 15 Nov 2002 02:11:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We encountered this same bug as part of upgrading to Struts 1.1 nightly 20021105.&lt;br/&gt;
In short, if the browser and server locales do not match, the struts&lt;br/&gt;
JavascriptValidation tag fails to include the dynamic part of the javascript,&lt;br/&gt;
and leaves the static part rendered on-screen.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Our validation.xml has a single formset, with no specification of language,&lt;br/&gt;
country or variant. Server was tomcat 4.0.4. Tested with servers set to locale&lt;br/&gt;
en_US and  en_GB. Tested with Mozilla and IE6 set to en_US and en_GB.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The struts-validator example application showed the same symtoms on &lt;b&gt;all&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
combinations of server, browser and locale.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The attached patch fixed our app. Haven&apos;t had time to check the validator app&lt;br/&gt;
though.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403197" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Thu, 5 Dec 2002 05:26:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Cleaned up code to do essentially the same thing as the patch, but with a lot &lt;br/&gt;
less code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;James&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-66] Validator for Email fails for top domains such as .travel or .museum</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-66</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the package: org.apache.commons.validator&lt;br/&gt;
In the class: EmailValidator&lt;br/&gt;
In the method: isValidSymbolicDomain &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is a restriction in the top domain lengths&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;        int len = i;&lt;br/&gt;
        if (domainSegment&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;len - 1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.length() &amp;lt; 2&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&apos;table-wrap&apos;&gt;
&lt;table class=&apos;confluenceTable&apos;&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;th class=&apos;confluenceTh&apos;&gt; domainSegment&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;len - 1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.length() &amp;gt; 4) 
{

            return false;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
Unfortunately this will limit the size between 2 and 4 characters.  But in the&lt;br/&gt;
list of top domains &lt;a href=&quot;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&lt;/a&gt;, there are&lt;br/&gt;
two domains that are larger than 4 characters: travel and museum, thus these&lt;br/&gt;
will fail.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
Fix, change the range from 2-4 to 2-6:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
     int len = i;&lt;br/&gt;
        if (domainSegment&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;len - 1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.length() &amp;lt; 2&lt;br/&gt;
                || domainSegment&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;len - 1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.length() &amp;gt; 6) {
            return false;        }&lt;/th&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342543">VALIDATOR-66</key>
            <summary>Validator for Email fails for top domains such as .travel or .museum</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="hfuentes@bluesocket.com">Hector Ho Fuentes</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 9 Sep 2005 00:35:30 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:07 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:07 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12410376" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 9 Sep 2005 00:47:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Might be better to use something like:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;private static final int TLD_MIN_LEN = 2;&lt;br/&gt;
private static final int TLD_MAX_LEN = 6; // or &quot;museum&quot;.length();&lt;br/&gt;
or even:&lt;br/&gt;
private static final int TLD_MAX_LEN = &lt;br/&gt;
   getProperty(&quot;org.apache.commons.validator.tld_max_eg&quot;,&quot;museum&quot;).length();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and use the contants in the validation routine.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410377" author="mrdon" created="Fri, 9 Sep 2005 00:58:58 +0000"  >

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-65] Validator doesn&apos;t pick up message replacement args</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-65</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When I use struts Validator Framework (in jakarta-struts-20030604.zip), I &lt;br/&gt;
configured validation.xml as follows:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;formset&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;form name=&quot;testForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
			&amp;lt;field property=&quot;testID&quot; depends=&quot;required&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
				&amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;prompt.testID&quot; /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
			&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
		&amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	&amp;lt;/formset&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And I found that arg0 element doesn&apos;t work: struts prompt &quot;null is required&quot;, &lt;br/&gt;
not &quot;testID is required&quot;. Then I test struts-example and found the same &lt;br/&gt;
prompt &quot;...null is required. null is required. null is required.&quot;!!!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340768">VALIDATOR-65</key>
            <summary>Validator doesn&apos;t pick up message replacement args</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

                            <comment id="12404418" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Sun, 8 Jun 2003 13:07:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The newer getArg(String, int) method now meets the contract for the deprecated&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-64] [validator] Validator 1.1.3 Logging causes Unparseable Date Exception</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-64</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In a Struts 1.2.4 application, I attempt to validate a date using &lt;br/&gt;
DatePatternStrict. I have logging in log4J set to &quot;warn&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I enter an invalid date, the application catches it, but also throws an &lt;br/&gt;
exception. If I turn logging to &quot;error&quot;, I get no such exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Relevant stacktrace follows.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;02:40:27,286  WARN GenericTypeValidator:220 - dsdsds&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.text.ParseException: Unparseable date: &quot;dsdsds&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
	at java.text.DateFormat.parse(DateFormat.java:335)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.validator.GenericTypeValidator.formatDate&lt;br/&gt;
(GenericTypeValidator.java:211)&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.struts.validator.FieldChecks.validateDate&lt;br/&gt;
(FieldChecks.java:521)&lt;br/&gt;
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)&lt;br/&gt;
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke&lt;br/&gt;
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341840">VALIDATOR-64</key>
            <summary>[validator] Validator 1.1.3 Logging causes Unparseable Date Exception</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-63] arg0 not passed through to dependent validator</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-63</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I was unsure of the version, but it&apos;s the one in Struts 1.1rc1. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I specify an intRange validation and the validation fails in the dependent&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;integer&quot; validation, the resource key passed in through arg0 doesn&apos;t get used&lt;br/&gt;
and  you get &quot;null is not an integer&quot;. The key DOES get used if the validation&lt;br/&gt;
fails in &quot;intRange&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A workaround is to specify an arg0 to the integer validation even though I am&lt;br/&gt;
not referring to it directly.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340663">VALIDATOR-63</key>
            <summary>arg0 not passed through to dependent validator</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dennis.doubleday@pncbank.com">Dennis Doubleday</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 15 Apr 2003 04:18:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:06 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:06 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12404091" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 15 Apr 2003 07:23:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can you attach your xml configuration section relating to this issue?  Is the &lt;br/&gt;
javascript or server side validation failing?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404092" author="dennis.doubleday@pncbank.com" created="Tue, 15 Apr 2003 21:45:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Validation does not fail, it works as expected. However, the message resource&lt;br/&gt;
doesn&apos;t get used. Here is an example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;field property=&quot;collateralPurchaseDateMonth&quot; depends=&quot;required,intRange&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;required&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;intRange&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg1 name=&quot;intRange&quot; key=&quot;${var:min}&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg2 name=&quot;intRange&quot; key=&quot;${var:max}&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;min&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;1&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;max&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;12&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The associated resources are:&lt;br/&gt;
errors.integer=&lt;/p&gt;
{0} must be a number.&lt;br/&gt;
errors.range={0}
&lt;p&gt; must be between &lt;/p&gt;
{1}
&lt;p&gt; and &lt;/p&gt;
{2}
&lt;p&gt;.&lt;br/&gt;
heil.errors.dateMonth.idText=The purchase date month&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now, if I enter something like &quot;13&quot; in the field, the intRange valication fails&lt;br/&gt;
and the error resource gets used correctly and &quot;The purchase date month must be&lt;br/&gt;
between 1 and 12.&quot; gets displayed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, if I enter something like &quot;xx&quot; in the field, the &quot;integer&quot; validation&lt;br/&gt;
that &quot;intRange&quot; depends on fails and the error resource apparently doesn&apos;t get&lt;br/&gt;
passed through because the message displayed is &quot;null must be a number.&quot; &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I add the following to the config:&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;integer&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;then the &quot;integer&quot; message works as expected. However, I don&apos;t think one should&lt;br/&gt;
have to explicitly specify args to implicitly called dependent tests. That would&lt;br/&gt;
be highly susceptible to breakage if the implicit dependency list changed.&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12404093" author="dennis.doubleday@pncbank.com" created="Tue, 15 Apr 2003 21:51:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, I should have said this anyway--I am using server-side validation only,&lt;br/&gt;
no JavaScript.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404094" author="mohankishore@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 16 Apr 2003 02:28:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Had a look at the code. It seems that &apos;Field&apos; has a default value for each arg &lt;br/&gt;
(i.e. arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3), and a map of actionName Vs value for each arg. &lt;br/&gt;
When you use field.getArg0(actionName), it checks the field for an arg0 with &lt;br/&gt;
name set to actionName. If missing it will return the default value.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So you have 2 work-arounds:&lt;br/&gt;
1) like you mentioned, list arg0 for each action:&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;required&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;intRange&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 name=&quot;integer&quot; key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
2) Or, as all of them are the same, provide a default value:&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;heil.errors.dateMonth.idText&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you try this and let us know?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404095" author="dennis.doubleday@pncbank.com" created="Wed, 16 Apr 2003 21:46:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, #2, the default arg0 work-around, does work and it is better than option&lt;br/&gt;
#1. It wouldn&apos;t work if the dependent validation required a different key, but&lt;br/&gt;
that is a corner case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think this bug could be closed with a documentation addition (assuming it&lt;br/&gt;
isn&apos;t already documented and I just missed it) of the default arg0 technique you&lt;br/&gt;
described. Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404096" author="mohankishore@yahoo.com" created="Thu, 17 Apr 2003 09:34:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Checked the documentation - it does mention the default and named argX elements.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
