<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-39] [validator] CreditValidator does not handle Visa correctly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-39</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using 5817550003933609 as card number the check will fail. This number is &lt;br/&gt;
a valid Visa number, as used for Visa Carte Blue in France.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Solution:&lt;br/&gt;
change the Visa inner class to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    private class Visa implements CreditCardType {&lt;br/&gt;
        private static final String PREFIX = &quot;4,5,&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
        public boolean matches(String card) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            
	  String prefix2 = card.substring(0, 1) + &quot;,&quot;;
            return ((PREFIX.indexOf(prefix2) != -1)
                    &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (card.length() == 13 || card.length() == 16));
        }
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342416">VALIDATOR-39</key>
            <summary>[validator] CreditValidator does not handle Visa correctly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="leo.moot@accenture.com">Leo Moot</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 29 Jul 2005 16:21:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:03 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:03 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12409944" author="mrdon" created="Mon, 15 Aug 2005 06:20:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in changeset &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;232646&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.  Thanks for the patch!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12409945" author="kutzi@gmx.de" created="Wed, 16 Nov 2005 23:20:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think that the patch is correct. It will match too many card numbers.&lt;br/&gt;
Mastercard numbers start e.g. with 51 - 55. Therefore Visa.matches() will now&lt;br/&gt;
return &quot;true&quot; for Mastercards, too.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12409946" author="niallp" created="Tue, 22 Nov 2005 10:49:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree with Christoph, this change renders the MasterCard check &lt;br/&gt;
redundant/useless.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Its hard to find an authoritative source defining the rules for credit card &lt;br/&gt;
numbers - looks like you have to buy the standards from ISO or ANSI. The other &lt;br/&gt;
validators I looked at only allow numbers starting with &quot;4&quot; for visa.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Leo can you point to a reference which defines the card number format for Visa &lt;br/&gt;
Carte Blue?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;At this point I&apos;m for rolling back this change. The &quot;Visa Carte Blue&quot; situation &lt;br/&gt;
can be resolved by creating a custom CreditCardType implementation and &lt;br/&gt;
registering it using the addAllowedCardType(CreditCardType) method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll leave this for a couple of weeks, to allow people to respond. After that, &lt;br/&gt;
unless convincing arguments are made, I&apos;ll revert this change.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12409947" author="niallp" created="Tue, 22 Nov 2005 11:17:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t know if they&apos;re authoritative but the following sources both define &lt;br/&gt;
visa as starting with &quot;4&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;   &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.merriampark.com/anatomycc.htm#Issuer&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.merriampark.com/anatomycc.htm#Issuer&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.encyclopedian.com/cr/Credit-card.html#Credit-card-numbering&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.encyclopedian.com/cr/Credit-card.html#Credit-card-numbering&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12409948" author="niallp" created="Sun, 8 Jan 2006 08:26:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have reversed this changed and so am closing this as &quot;WONTFIX&quot; &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=366867&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=366867&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-38</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Are there any problems with the Digester instance created in &lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-36] unknown host when loading app</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-36</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The ValidatorResourcesInitializer class in commons-validator.jar included in &lt;br/&gt;
struts 1.1 distribution refers to an inconsistent &lt;br/&gt;
dtd &quot;/org/apache/commons/validator/resources/validator_1_0_1.dtd&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340573">VALIDATOR-36</key>
            <summary>unknown host when loading app</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg">Blocker</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="didier.romelot@renault.com">Didier Romelot</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 27 Feb 2003 16:15:15 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 16 May 2006 12:42:28 +0000</updated>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403730" author="martinc" created="Fri, 28 Feb 2003 02:54:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Could you please clarify what you mean by &quot;an inconsistent dtd&quot;?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403731" author="didier.romelot@renault.com" created="Fri, 28 Feb 2003 03:18:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The ValidatorResourcesInitializer try to register a &quot;1_0_1&quot; dtd (source code &lt;br/&gt;
below), but there is only a &quot;1_0&quot; dtd file in the jar file. When loading the &lt;br/&gt;
application, the dtd is not found and is serached on the internet...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;---------------------------------------------------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
    protected static String registrations[] = &lt;/p&gt;
{
        &quot;-//Apache Software Foundation//DTD Commons Validator Rules 
Configuration 
1.0.1//EN&quot;, &quot;/org/apache/commons/validator/resources/validator_1_0_1.dtd&quot;
    }
&lt;p&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
---------------------------------------------------------------------------&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403732" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Fri, 28 Feb 2003 11:28:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It looks like a simple problem in the validator&apos;s build.xml file not copying the &lt;br/&gt;
1.0.1 dtd.  I don&apos;t have validator setup to build so can one of you validator &lt;br/&gt;
gurus try this out?&lt;/p&gt;




&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;copy    todir=&quot;${build.home}/classes/org/apache/commons/validator/resources/&quot;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;              file=&quot;${conf.home}/validator_1_0_1.dtd&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403733" author="didier.romelot@renault.com" created="Fri, 28 Feb 2003 15:21:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We only use struts binary distribution which is not correctly build.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403734" author="martinc" created="Mon, 3 Mar 2003 08:50:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure that David&apos;s suggested fix is the right fix. Unless 1.0 rules &lt;br/&gt;
files don&apos;t work with 1.0.1, I think we should be distributing both DTDs, and &lt;br/&gt;
registering both locally.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403735" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 11 Mar 2003 22:56:56 +0000"  >&lt;ul&gt;

registered.  Since apps with 1.0 DTD refereneces will still not resolve locally &lt;br/&gt;
unless both DTD&apos;s are shipped and registered.  This is similar to how struts &lt;br/&gt;
registers and ships both the 1.0 and 1.1 DTD versions.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403737" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Wed, 12 Mar 2003 14:09:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Validator now registers both 1.0 and 1.0.1 dtds.  Also, both dtds are now &lt;br/&gt;
included in the distribution.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-35] The website reffers to version 1.1.0 but the last released version I find is 1.0.2</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-35</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;All the pages on the site show this in the header:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;     Last published: 13 September 2003 | Doc for 1.1.0&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But when you go to get either the source or binaries the latest version&lt;br/&gt;
available is 1.0.2&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341007">VALIDATOR-35</key>
            <summary>The website reffers to version 1.1.0 but the last released version I find is 1.0.2</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

                <created>Tue, 30 Sep 2003 02:07:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:02 +0000</updated>

                                    <version>1.1.0 (alpha)</version>

                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12405188" author="rleland" created="Tue, 30 Sep 2003 02:27:29 +0000"  >
&lt;p&gt;There was a released 1.1.0 version back on Aug 28.&lt;br/&gt;
We have moved to Apache httpd style releases.&lt;br/&gt;
When a release is created it is initially only&lt;br/&gt;
announced on the developers list.&lt;br/&gt;
This is because all release are initially be considered&lt;br/&gt;
Alpha quality. So right now it is under&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/~rleland/ValidatorAlpha&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/~rleland/ValidatorAlpha&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Then after they have been used for some time&lt;br/&gt;
there can be a vote to promote that very same release to&lt;br/&gt;
Beta, or general release. If promoted to a beta or general release&lt;br/&gt;
the binary is moved from&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/~rleland/ValidatorAlpha&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/~rleland/ValidatorAlpha&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
to the normal distribution places.&lt;br/&gt;
then an announcement is made on both the commons-dev, commons-user,&lt;br/&gt;
general lists, and then the main web site.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You&apos;re welcome to try it out so we can have feed back and reason to&lt;br/&gt;
promote it to a higher rating.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405189" author="geigleing@peacetech.com" created="Tue, 30 Sep 2003 03:28:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That is nice.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You might think about refering to the released version and it&apos;s documentation on&lt;br/&gt;
the public site (&lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/index.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/index.html&lt;/a&gt;) instead&lt;br/&gt;
of  a version that is not currently targeted at the public.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-33] [Validator] Javascript Validation currently uses unsupported DOM method getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-33</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The use of Element.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;) is not supported by IE prior to&lt;br/&gt;
version 6. This error was reportedly fixed in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-80&quot; title=&quot;[validator] All validation fails when &amp;quot;name&amp;quot; attribute in form not specified&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-80&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-2145&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; but the resolution to&lt;br/&gt;
still uses getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;document.getAttributeNode() is present in:&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateFloatRange.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateShort.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMinLength.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateDate.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateEmail.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateByte.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateIntRange.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMask.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateCreditCard.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateInteger.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateMaxLength.js&lt;br/&gt;
./jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javascript/validateFloat.js&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is issue has also previously been raised in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-73&quot; title=&quot;[validator] validateRequired.js uses unsupported DOM method for validation.&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-73&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-1622&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, with an appropriate&lt;br/&gt;
 patch being supplied.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342669">VALIDATOR-33</key>
            <summary>[Validator] Javascript Validation currently uses unsupported DOM method getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jwilliams@judcom.nsw.gov.au">Jeffrey Williams</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 1 Nov 2005 12:46:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:02 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:02 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12410737" author="niallp" created="Tue, 1 Nov 2005 13:27:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Firstly, there is no reference to getAttributeNode() in any of the scripts you &lt;br/&gt;
indicate since the fix/patch applied for Firstly, there is no reference to getAttributeNode() in any of the scripts you &lt;br/&gt;
indicate since the fix/patch applied for Bug 35127 refactored the code to get &lt;br/&gt;
the form name into a separate utility method - retrieveFormName() - which is &lt;br/&gt;
located in validateUtilities.js&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Having said that - that script does still use the getAttributeNode() function, &lt;br/&gt;
but IMO its now less of an issue - since anyone wanting IE 5.5 support can &lt;br/&gt;
simply provide their own implementation of that method and configure validator &lt;br/&gt;
to use it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Personally I haven&apos;t been involved in that change and don&apos;t have a copy of IE &lt;br/&gt;
5.5 to test on. If you could supply a patch which resolves this in IE 5.5 then &lt;br/&gt;
I will apply it. It needs to be soon though, if you want it included in &lt;br/&gt;
Validator 1.2.0 - I just finished rolling &quot;release candidate 2&quot; when you posted &lt;br/&gt;
this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg68919.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg68919.html&lt;/a&gt; refactored the code to get &lt;br/&gt;
the form name into a separate utility method - retrieveFormName() - which is &lt;br/&gt;
located in validateUtilities.js&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Having said that - that script does still use the getAttributeNode() function, &lt;br/&gt;
but IMO its now less of an issue - since anyone wanting IE 5.5 support can &lt;br/&gt;
simply provide their own implementation of that method and configure validator &lt;br/&gt;
to use it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Personally I haven&apos;t been involved in that change and don&apos;t have a copy of IE &lt;br/&gt;
5.5 to test on. If you could supply a patch which resolves this in IE 5.5 then &lt;br/&gt;
I will apply it. It needs to be soon though, if you want it included in &lt;br/&gt;
Validator 1.2.0 - I just finished rolling &quot;release candidate 2&quot; when you posted &lt;br/&gt;
this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg68919.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg68919.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410738" author="jwilliams@judcom.nsw.gov.au" created="Tue, 1 Nov 2005 14:32:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=16845)&lt;br/&gt;
IE 5 fix for getAttributeNode() in validateUtilities.js&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is a simple fix changing the getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;) function to&lt;br/&gt;
getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;) to allow javascript validation to work in IE 5+.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410739" author="niallp" created="Wed, 2 Nov 2005 05:44:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I tried your patch out in the struts-examples webapp, using IE6 and it caused a &lt;br/&gt;
problem.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Form happended to have an text input field with name=&quot;name&quot; and the &lt;br/&gt;
getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;) method returned the input field rather than the name of &lt;br/&gt;
the form.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also looking at this method - seems inconsistent to me that it used form.id to &lt;br/&gt;
check the id and form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;) for the name. Maybe something &lt;br/&gt;
like the following would be better:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;function retrieveFormName(form) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    if (form.getAttributeNode) {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &lt;br/&gt;
            form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).value;
        }
&lt;p&gt;   } else if (form.getAttribute) {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;);
        }
&lt;p&gt;    } else {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.id) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.id;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.name;
        }
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any comments appreciated as javascript isn&apos;t my forte.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410740" author="jwilliams@judcom.nsw.gov.au" created="Wed, 2 Nov 2005 07:58:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I tested your suggestion in IE 5 and it failed when it had a input field with&lt;br/&gt;
name=&quot;name&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I made a slight change and tested in IE 5,6, and latest firefox and it appears&lt;br/&gt;
to work fine:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  function retrieveFormName(form) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    if (form.getAttributeNode) {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
            form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).value;
        }
&lt;p&gt;   } else if (form.getAttribute) {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.attributes[&quot;name&quot;];
        }
&lt;p&gt;    } else {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (form.id) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.id;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return form.name;
        }
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12410741" author="niallp" created="Wed, 2 Nov 2005 20:58:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Jeffrey, thanks for the feedback - I&apos;ve applied this change with the &lt;br/&gt;
modification you suggested.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410742" author="john@h3.com" created="Fri, 24 Feb 2006 00:07:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Guys, there is a bug in &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt; (see&lt;br/&gt;
Comment 5). The code there, a bit different from what Jeffrey gives in Comment&lt;br/&gt;
4, goes:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;function retrieveFormName(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
      if (form.getAttributeNode) {&lt;br/&gt;
          if (form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value) &lt;/p&gt;
{
              return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value;
          }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
              return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).value;
          }
&lt;p&gt;      } else if (form.getAttribute) {&lt;br/&gt;
          if (form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
              return form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);
          }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
              form.attributes[&quot;name&quot;]; // *****PROBLEM*****
          }
&lt;p&gt;      } else {&lt;br/&gt;
          if (form.id) &lt;/p&gt;
{
              return form.id;
          }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
              return form.name;
          }
&lt;p&gt;      }&lt;br/&gt;
  }  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem marked above is that there is no return statement. I.e., it should be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;              return form.attributes&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot;name&amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;
			&lt;ul&gt;
				&lt;li&gt;
				&lt;ul&gt;
					&lt;li&gt;Because of this, the Javascript produces an error on IE 5.0 and 5.5.&lt;/li&gt;
				&lt;/ul&gt;
				&lt;/li&gt;
			&lt;/ul&gt;
			&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12410743" author="niallp" created="Fri, 24 Feb 2006 02:06:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #6)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Guys, there is a bug in &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=330237&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt; &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This has already been raised (see &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-18&quot; title=&quot;[validator] Validation in MSIE5.0&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-18&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-2690&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;) and fixed:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.mail-archive.com/user%40struts.apache.org/msg39542.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.mail-archive.com/user%40struts.apache.org/msg39542.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=366458&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=366458&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please could you check the latest source in subversion before re-opening &lt;br/&gt;
tickets:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/cvs-usage.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/validator/cvs-usage.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Niall&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-32] [validator] datePattern not supported by JavaScript</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-32</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;datePattern and datePatternStrict are picked up by the Java side, but only&lt;br/&gt;
datePatternStrict is picked up by the JavaScript. Entering datePattern as part&lt;br/&gt;
of your validation will result in a JavaScript error on the client.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340903">VALIDATOR-32</key>
            <summary>[validator] datePattern not supported by JavaScript</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="nsydenham@yahoo.co.uk">Nick Sydenham</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 13 Aug 2003 23:18:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:02 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:02 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.1.0 (alpha)</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>

                            <comment id="12404846" author="nsydenham@yahoo.co.uk" created="Thu, 14 Aug 2003 23:19:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=7824)&lt;br/&gt;
Check for null datePatternStrict&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404847" author="derek@chen-becker.org" created="Fri, 26 Sep 2003 23:38:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This patch fixes it on my stuff:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;validator-rules.xml.orig    2003-09-26 10:32:05.000000000 -0600&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;validator-rules.xml 2003-09-26 10:32:27.000000000 -0600&lt;br/&gt;
***************&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;615,618 ****&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;615,621 ----&lt;br/&gt;
                     var value = form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].value;&lt;br/&gt;
                     var datePattern = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&quot;datePatternStrict&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
+                    // try loose pattern&lt;br/&gt;
+                    if (datePattern == null)&lt;br/&gt;
+                        datePattern = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&quot;datePattern&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
                     if ((form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].type == &apos;text&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                          form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].type == &apos;textarea&apos;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12404848" author="rleland" created="Fri, 26 Sep 2003 23:45:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This should stay opened until it is fixed in the source code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404849" author="rleland" created="Fri, 26 Sep 2003 23:57:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in the Sept 27 Nightly build.&lt;br/&gt;
Thanks for the patch !&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Rob&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404850" author="hchar" created="Tue, 4 Jan 2005 15:17:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch only fixed part of the problem.  The regular expression used when&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;datePattern&quot; is selected is still incorrect.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The patch should be something like:&lt;br/&gt;
...&lt;br/&gt;
                   var isStrict = true&lt;br/&gt;
                   var datePattern = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&quot;datePatternStrict&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                   if (datePattern == null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
	                   datePattern = oDate[x][2](&quot;datePattern&quot;)
	                   isStrict = false
	               }&lt;br/&gt;
...&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
                            dateRegexp = isStrict &lt;br/&gt;
                            		   ? new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4})$&quot;) &lt;br/&gt;
                            		   : new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
....&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
The replacement script for the entire &quot;date&quot; validator is given here:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;date&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
            classname=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.FieldChecks&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
               method=&quot;validateDate&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
         methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.commons.validator.Field,&lt;br/&gt;
                       org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors,&lt;br/&gt;
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
              depends=&quot;&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  msg=&quot;errors.date&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
       jsFunctionName=&quot;DateValidations&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
         &amp;lt;javascript&amp;gt;&amp;lt;![CDATA[&lt;br/&gt;
            function validateDate(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
               var bValid = true;&lt;br/&gt;
               var focusField = null;&lt;br/&gt;
               var i = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
               var fields = new Array();&lt;br/&gt;
               oDate = new DateValidations();&lt;br/&gt;
               for (x in oDate) {&lt;br/&gt;
                   var value = form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].value;&lt;br/&gt;
                   var isStrict = true&lt;br/&gt;
                   var datePattern = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&quot;datePatternStrict&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
                   &lt;br/&gt;
                   if (datePattern == null) {	                   datePattern = oDate[x][2](&quot;datePattern&quot;)	                   isStrict = false	               }
&lt;p&gt;                   if ((form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].type == &apos;text&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                        form[oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;].type == &apos;textarea&apos;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                       (value.length &amp;gt; 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                       (datePattern.length &amp;gt; 0)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                     var MONTH = &quot;MM&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
                     var DAY = &quot;dd&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
                     var YEAR = &quot;yyyy&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
                     var orderMonth = datePattern.indexOf(MONTH);&lt;br/&gt;
                     var orderDay = datePattern.indexOf(DAY);&lt;br/&gt;
                     var orderYear = datePattern.indexOf(YEAR);&lt;br/&gt;
                     if ((orderDay &amp;lt; orderYear &amp;amp;&amp;amp; orderDay &amp;gt; orderMonth)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim1 = orderMonth + MONTH.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim2 = orderDay + DAY.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim1 = datePattern.substring(iDelim1, iDelim1 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim2 = datePattern.substring(iDelim2, iDelim2 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if (iDelim1 == orderDay &amp;amp;&amp;amp; iDelim2 == orderYear) {&lt;br/&gt;
                            dateRegexp = isStrict &lt;br/&gt;
                            		   ? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;) &lt;br/&gt;
                            		   : new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim1 == orderDay) {&lt;br/&gt;
                            dateRegexp = isStrict &lt;br/&gt;
                            		   ? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)[&quot; + delim2 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                            		   : new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})[&quot; + delim2&lt;br/&gt;
+ &quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim2 == orderYear) {&lt;br/&gt;
                            dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                              		   ? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                            		   : new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                         } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                            dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                            		   ? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                            		   : new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         }&lt;br/&gt;
                         var matched = dateRegexp.exec(value);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if(matched != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
                            if (!isValidDate(matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;3&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                               if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                   focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                               }
&lt;p&gt;                               fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                               bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                            }&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                            if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                            }
&lt;p&gt;                            fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                            bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                         }&lt;br/&gt;
                     } else if ((orderMonth &amp;lt; orderYear &amp;amp;&amp;amp; orderMonth &amp;gt; orderDay)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim1 = orderDay + DAY.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim2 = orderMonth + MONTH.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim1 = datePattern.substring(iDelim1, iDelim1 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim2 = datePattern.substring(iDelim2, iDelim2 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if (iDelim1 == orderMonth &amp;amp;&amp;amp; iDelim2 == orderYear) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict &lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim1 == orderMonth) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)[&quot; + delim2 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})[&quot; + delim2 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim2 == orderYear) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2}
&lt;p&gt;)&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(\\d{1,2})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2})&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         }&lt;br/&gt;
                         var matched = dateRegexp.exec(value);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if(matched != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             if (!isValidDate(matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;3&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                                 if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                     focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                                 }
&lt;p&gt;                                 fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                                 bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                              }&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                             if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                 focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                             }
&lt;p&gt;                             fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                             bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                         }&lt;br/&gt;
                     } else if ((orderMonth &amp;gt; orderYear &amp;amp;&amp;amp; orderMonth &amp;lt; orderDay)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim1 = orderYear + YEAR.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var iDelim2 = orderMonth + MONTH.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim1 = datePattern.substring(iDelim1, iDelim1 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         var delim2 = datePattern.substring(iDelim2, iDelim2 + 1);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if (iDelim1 == orderMonth &amp;amp;&amp;amp; iDelim2 == orderDay) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim1 == orderMonth) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})[&quot; + delim2 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{1,2})[&quot; + delim2 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else if (iDelim2 == orderDay) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{1,2})(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                             dateRegexp = isStrict&lt;br/&gt;
                             			? new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{4})[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{2})$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                             			: new RegExp(&quot;^(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{4}
&lt;p&gt;)[&quot; + delim1 +&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;](&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d&lt;/p&gt;
{1,2})&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot; + delim2 + &amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;d{1,2}
&lt;p&gt;)$&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
                         }&lt;br/&gt;
                         var matched = dateRegexp.exec(value);&lt;br/&gt;
                         if(matched != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
                             if (!isValidDate(matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;3&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, matched&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                                 if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                     focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                                  }
&lt;p&gt;                                  fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                                  bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                              }&lt;br/&gt;
                          } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                              if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                                  focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                              }
&lt;p&gt;                              fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                              bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                          }&lt;br/&gt;
                     } else {&lt;br/&gt;
                         if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                             focusField = form[oDate[x][0]];
                         }
&lt;p&gt;                         fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                         bValid =  false;&lt;br/&gt;
                     }&lt;br/&gt;
                  }&lt;br/&gt;
               }&lt;br/&gt;
               if (fields.length &amp;gt; 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                  focusField.focus();
                  alert(fields.join(&apos;\n&apos;));
               }
&lt;p&gt;               return bValid;&lt;br/&gt;
            }&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;	    function isValidDate(day, month, year) {&lt;br/&gt;
	        if (month &amp;lt; 1 || month &amp;gt; 12) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                    return false;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
                if (day &amp;lt; 1 || day &amp;gt; 31) {                    return false;                }
&lt;p&gt;                if ((month == 4 || month == 6 || month == 9 || month == 11) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                    (day == 31)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                    return false;
                }
&lt;p&gt;                if (month == 2) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    var leap = (year % 4 == 0 &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                               (year % 100 != 0 || year % 400 == 0));&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (day&amp;gt;29 || (day == 29 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !leap)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        return false;
                    }
&lt;p&gt;                }&lt;br/&gt;
                return true;&lt;br/&gt;
            }]]&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
         &amp;lt;/javascript&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/validator&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404851" author="hchar" created="Tue, 4 Jan 2005 15:23:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As a general comment, most if not all of the semi-colon&apos;s in the javascript are&lt;br/&gt;
unncessary and should be removed to reduce the payload.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404852" author="martinc" created="Wed, 5 Jan 2005 08:16:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The semi-colons should absolutely not be removed. They may &quot;reduce the payload&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
minimally, but if someone uses a whitespace compressor on the code, it would &lt;br/&gt;
completely break it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404853" author="hchar" created="Wed, 5 Jan 2005 09:25:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Which browser currently uses such &quot;whitespace compressor&quot; ?  Sound like more a&lt;br/&gt;
compressor problem, which should then add in the necessary semi-colons.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404854" author="martinc" created="Tue, 11 Jan 2005 15:20:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Browsers don&apos;t use whitespace compressors. Why would they? The point is to &lt;br/&gt;
reduce the network load in getting the JavaScript to the browser in the first &lt;br/&gt;
place.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Sure, you could ask all of the whitespace compressor developers to fix their &lt;br/&gt;
code to handle missing semi-colons. But I think we&apos;re going to have a much &lt;br/&gt;
easier time fixing the code under our control rather than the code we don&apos;t &lt;br/&gt;
have any influence over. &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404855" author="mrdon" created="Sat, 19 Mar 2005 16:02:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Moving to commons-validator&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404856" author="mrdon" created="Sat, 19 Mar 2005 16:02:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Moving to commons-validator&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404857" author="mrdon" created="Wed, 24 Aug 2005 12:48:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in revision &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;239517&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.  Thanks Hanson for the patch!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404858" author="mrdon" created="Wed, 24 Aug 2005 12:49:23 +0000"  >&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-31] [email] Valid email does not pass the check</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-31</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;br/&gt;
According to ICANN &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.icann.org/faq/#regother&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.icann.org/faq/#regother&lt;/a&gt; *.museum is the perfect&lt;br/&gt;
domain name. But the isValidSymbolicDomain(String domain) method of&lt;br/&gt;
EmailValidator refuses to accept it&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342159">VALIDATOR-31</key>
            <summary>[email] Valid email does not pass the check</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-30] [validator] API Bug in org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-30</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Why is the class protected:&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult.ResultStatus&lt;br/&gt;
I implemented a special ValidatorForm that needs to access to this object to&lt;br/&gt;
check that no validations error exists for a particular property form and if so&lt;br/&gt;
do some job, I don&apos;t find any other way than accessing to this object.&lt;br/&gt;
In my opinion, it&apos;s an API bug, because the method&lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorResult#getActionMap() is public but it return a map where values are&lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorResult.ResultStatus making this method useless.&lt;br/&gt;
Could ValidatorResult.ResultStatus become public ?&lt;br/&gt;
I can send you the patch but is it necessary regarding the modification &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Thank you.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342761">VALIDATOR-30</key>
            <summary>[validator] API Bug in org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com">Philippe Mouawad</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 30 Nov 2005 08:54:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.2.0 Release</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12410980" author="niallp" created="Sun, 8 Jan 2006 08:23:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree its inconsistent, but orginally the Map contained just Boolean objects &lt;br/&gt;
rather than ResultStatus objects.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Its not completely useless as there is a way round this (in Validator 1.2.0) - &lt;br/&gt;
you can get the Map and iterate through the keys and then use those keys to &lt;br/&gt;
call the following ValidatorResult methods to access the ValidatorStatus values &lt;br/&gt;
for an action:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    public boolean isValid(String validatorName)&lt;br/&gt;
    public Object getResult(String validatorName)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;From what you say would a general isValid() method which checks all the actions &lt;br/&gt;
the ValidatorResult contains be more useful to you?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Another option would be to deprecate the getActionMap() method and replace it &lt;br/&gt;
with a method that returns an Iterator of the action names.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Opnions?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410981" author="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 04:31:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;What I need is to get for each property of the Form the validation status&lt;br/&gt;
(success of failure) and&lt;br/&gt;
No I can&apos;t do it with the methods you&apos;re talking about, here is the code I am using:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        Set set = validatorResults.getPropertyNames();&lt;br/&gt;
        Map propertyMap = new HashMap();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        for (Iterator iter = set.iterator(); iter.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
			String property= (String) iter.next();&lt;br/&gt;
            propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.TRUE);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;			ValidatorResult result = validatorResults.getValidatorResult(property);&lt;br/&gt;
			Map map = result.getActionMap();&lt;br/&gt;
			for (Iterator iterator = map.values().iterator(); iterator.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
// Here I need to access ValidatorResult.ResultStatus &lt;br/&gt;
				ValidatorResult.ResultStatus element = (ValidatorResult.ResultStatus)&lt;br/&gt;
iterator.next();&lt;br/&gt;
				if (!element.isValid())&lt;/p&gt;
				{
                    propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.FALSE);
					break;
				}
&lt;p&gt;			}			&lt;br/&gt;
		}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;At this step, propertyMap contains what I need, for each property of the form&lt;br/&gt;
whether it&apos;s right or not.&lt;br/&gt;
Thank you.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410982" author="niallp" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 06:29:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #2)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; No I can&apos;t do it with the methods you&apos;re talking about, here is the code I am &lt;br/&gt;
using:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think you&apos;re wrong, why wouldn&apos;t the following work?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Set set = validatorResults.getPropertyNames();&lt;br/&gt;
    Map propertyMap = new HashMap();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    for (Iterator iter = set.iterator(); iter.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
        String property= (String) iter.next();&lt;br/&gt;
        propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.TRUE);&lt;br/&gt;
        ValidatorResult result = validatorResults.getValidatorResult(property);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        Iterator map = result.getActionMap();&lt;br/&gt;
        for (Iterator iterator = map.keySet().iterator(); iterator.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
            String validatorName = (String)iterator.next();&lt;br/&gt;
            if (!result.isValid(validatorName)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.FALSE);
                break;
            }
&lt;p&gt;        }&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410983" author="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 07:04:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, you&apos;re right.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410984" author="niallp" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 07:22:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK good - that gives you a solution for the moment. However your original &lt;br/&gt;
assertion that there is a problem with a Map of ResultStatus is still true and &lt;br/&gt;
the question is what to do about them. Heres the possible options...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;1) Do nothing&lt;br/&gt;
2) Do as you requested and make ResultStatus a public class.&lt;br/&gt;
3) Change the getActionMap to return a Map of &quot;Boolean&quot; values, as it did &lt;br/&gt;
originally.&lt;br/&gt;
4) Deprecate getActionMap and provide an Iterator for the action names.&lt;br/&gt;
5) Provide an isValid() method which checks all the contained actions.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My preference is to do both 3) and 4). I&apos;d rather not do 2) because I&apos;m not &lt;br/&gt;
convinced there is a need for ResultStatus and making it public will just make &lt;br/&gt;
it harder to remove at a later date.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Unless there are objections I&apos;ll go ahead with 2) and 4).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410985" author="niallp" created="Tue, 10 Jan 2006 09:42:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;getActionMap() is deprecated (behaviour unchanged) and theres now a new &lt;br/&gt;
getActions() method which provides an Iterator for the action names&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367437&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367437&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;closing as FIXED&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410986" author="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com" created="Wed, 11 Jan 2006 19:09:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In fact I answered too fast, there is a little performance problem with what &lt;br/&gt;
you proposed:&lt;br/&gt;
        Set set = validatorResults.getPropertyNames();&lt;br/&gt;
        Map propertyMap = new HashMap();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        for (Iterator iter = set.iterator(); iter.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
            String property= (String) iter.next();&lt;br/&gt;
            propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.TRUE);&lt;br/&gt;
            ValidatorResult result = validatorResults.getValidatorResult&lt;br/&gt;
(property);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            Map map = result.getActionMap();&lt;br/&gt;
            for (Iterator iterator = map.keySet().iterator(); iterator.hasNext&lt;br/&gt;
()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
                String validatorName = (String)iterator.next();&lt;br/&gt;
                if (!result.isValid(validatorName)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                    propertyMap.put(property, Boolean.FALSE);
                    break;
                }
&lt;p&gt;            }&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With my approach I don&apos;t need to get the value:&lt;br/&gt;
for (Iterator iterator = map.values().iterator(); iterator.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorResult.ResultStatus element = (ValidatorResult.ResultStatus) &lt;br/&gt;
iterator.next();&lt;br/&gt;
if (!element.isValid())&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;While with yours:&lt;br/&gt;
Map map = result.getActionMap();&lt;br/&gt;
for (Iterator iterator = map.keySet().iterator(); iterator.hasNext()&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; {&lt;br/&gt;
     String validatorName = (String)iterator.next();&lt;br/&gt;
     if (!result.isValid(validatorName)) =====&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; Here&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What I need and I think would be useful for others is:&lt;br/&gt;
Get for each field of the form whether it is in error or not.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you.&lt;br/&gt;
Philippe.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12410987" author="niallp" created="Fri, 10 Feb 2006 23:23:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #7)&lt;br/&gt;

&amp;gt; you proposed:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt; What I need and I think would be useful for others is:&lt;br/&gt;

you open a new bug ticket for this please (since its a new/different request &lt;br/&gt;
and I&apos;ve already implemented a fix for the original issue).&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-29] floatRange does not check decimals (Struts 1.1RC2/ Commons Validator 1.0.2)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-29</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;for floatRange max 9.99 it is valid to enter 9.999, which is bigger &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/sad.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340799">VALIDATOR-29</key>
            <summary>floatRange does not check decimals (Struts 1.1RC2/ Commons Validator 1.0.2)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dirk.sturzebecher@ovsag.de">Dirk Sturzebecher</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 19 Jun 2003 00:50:45 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</updated>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12404543" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Thu, 19 Jun 2003 02:51:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Does this happen in the javascript or server side checks or both?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404544" author="dirk.sturzebecher@ovsag.de" created="Thu, 19 Jun 2003 21:55:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I did NOT try the javascript, thus it is on the server side&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404545" author="husted@apache.org" created="Wed, 25 Jun 2003 16:12:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If it is on the server-side, then the report would be against the Commons&lt;br/&gt;
Validator 1.0.2. Accordingly, I&apos;m switching the report over to that queue. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404546" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Thu, 26 Jun 2003 07:01:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The 1.1RC2 struts-validator webapp correctly validates 9.999 against a max of 9.&lt;br/&gt;
99 in the javascript and the server side checks.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_10010" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:importid">
                        <customfieldname>Bugzilla Id</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
