<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-28] [validator]javascript date validation failure</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-28</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;if neither datePattern nor datePatternStrict is specified in validation.xml, &lt;br/&gt;
the validation should use the short date pattern of user&apos;s locale or default &lt;br/&gt;
locale. The client side validation always fails (javascript error occurs) when &lt;br/&gt;
no date pattern is specified for the field. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Javascript error in function &quot;validateDate(form)&quot; : &lt;br/&gt;
datePattern has no properties on line :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if ((field.type == &apos;hidden&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;text&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;textarea&apos;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
               (value.length &amp;gt; 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (datePattern.length &amp;gt; 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I suggest that function is modified so it tests whether datePattern is null &lt;br/&gt;
after instruction &quot;datePattern = oDate&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&quot;datePattern&quot;);&quot; and if so &lt;br/&gt;
initializes it to a global javascript variable that would be dynamically &lt;br/&gt;
generated with a value based on the locale : ((SimpleDateFormat) &lt;br/&gt;
DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.SHORT, theUsersLocale)).toPattern&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342771">VALIDATOR-28</key>
            <summary>[validator]javascript date validation failure</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="franck1993@yahoo.fr">franck93</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 2 Dec 2005 22:02:14 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12411013" author="niallp" created="Fri, 6 Jan 2006 03:29:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The &quot;dynamic&quot; javascript that picks up the parameters such as date pattern is &lt;br/&gt;
generated using the Struts javascript tag, so using a default pattern if no &lt;br/&gt;
parameter is supplied would need to go there. However, that tag has no &lt;br/&gt;
knowledge of individual validators parameters - so there isn&apos;t a good way of &lt;br/&gt;
fixing it there.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;All these sorts of issues can easily be resolved if I ever get back to actually &lt;br/&gt;
implementing the rendering extension I proposed a while ago (see &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-106&quot; title=&quot;[validator] Javascript Rendering Extension&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-106&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-1729&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;) - &lt;br/&gt;
since Commons Validator would become resonsible for rendering the dynamic &lt;br/&gt;
javascript and the proposal includes having a script renderer for each &lt;br/&gt;
validator which understands the parameters each validator needs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll add a note to that bug for now referencing this one - marking this as &lt;br/&gt;
LATER.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-27] [validator] UrlValidator fails http://www.google.com</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-27</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Per discussion on commons-dev list the following isValid method should not &lt;br/&gt;
return false for &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.google.com&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.google.com&lt;/a&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public void testSanity() {&lt;br/&gt;
        UrlValidator v = new UrlValidator();&lt;br/&gt;
        assertTrue(v.isValid(&quot;http://www.google.com&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Bug/enhancement I think is to make port and path optional tokens of the url.&lt;br/&gt;
Full thread available here:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg46584.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev%40jakarta.apache.org/msg46584.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341642">VALIDATOR-27</key>
            <summary>[validator] UrlValidator fails http://www.google.com</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tim.reilly@consultant.com">Tim Reilly</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 16 Aug 2004 09:16:15 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 19 Jul 2006 14:13:24 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.2.0 Release</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>3</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12407254" author="tim.reilly@consultant.com" created="Thu, 19 Aug 2004 04:11:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Seems the issue is isValidPath(&quot;&quot;) returns false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-From rfc2396&lt;br/&gt;
   The authority component is preceded by a double slash &quot;//&quot; and is&lt;br/&gt;
   terminated by the next slash &quot;/&quot;, question-mark &quot;?&quot;,or by the end of&lt;br/&gt;
   the URI.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To accomodate &quot;&quot; as valid the forthcoming patches change the regular expression &lt;br/&gt;
to allow zero or more:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;private static final String PATH_PATTERN =&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&quot;/^(/&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-a-zA-Z0-9_:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&amp;#39;%$&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;*)$/&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
+            &quot;/^(/&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-a-zA-Z0-9_:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&amp;#39;%$&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;b&gt;)&lt;/b&gt;$/&quot;;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Also changes to unit test data expects true when path = &quot;&quot; in both default &lt;br/&gt;
fragement and no fragement options&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please verify (read scrutinize) &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;br/&gt;
-TR&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PS - I didn&apos;t see the js implementation for UrlValidator. If I missed it sorry -&lt;br/&gt;
 if changes accepted though I assume it would need the change as well?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407255" author="tim.reilly@consultant.com" created="Thu, 19 Aug 2004 04:13:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=12480)&lt;br/&gt;
Adds * to path expression to allow zero&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407256" author="tim.reilly@consultant.com" created="Thu, 19 Aug 2004 04:13:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=12481)&lt;br/&gt;
Changes expect from false to true for &quot;&quot; path data&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407257" author="martinc" created="Fri, 27 Aug 2004 04:40:28 +0000"  >&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;*** Bug 30757 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12407258" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Sun, 10 Oct 2004 23:46:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think we could also simplify that expression by using \w :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;private static final String PATH_PATTERN =&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&quot;/^(/&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-a-zA-Z0-9_:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&amp;#39;%$&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;b&gt;)&lt;/b&gt;$/&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
+            &quot;/^(/&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-\w:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&amp;#39;%$&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;b&gt;)&lt;/b&gt;$/&quot;;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12407259" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Mon, 1 Nov 2004 11:39:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When I added the * to the end of the path regex the testSanity() method passes.&lt;br/&gt;
 However, when I added another line to testSanity() like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;assertTrue(v.isValid(&quot;http://www.google.com/&quot;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;it fails.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407260" author="rwinston@eircom.net" created="Mon, 1 Nov 2004 19:16:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Is it because it appends a port and querystring to the result?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I added (&quot;www.google.com/&quot;, true) as a new TestPair, and got the exception:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;testIsValid(org.apache.commons.validator.UrlTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://www.google.com/:80?action=view&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.google.com/:80?action=view&lt;/a&gt; expected:&amp;lt;false&amp;gt; but was:&amp;lt;true&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i.e. it appends a :80?action=view , which obviously will fail due to the&lt;br/&gt;
trailing &apos;/&apos;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407261" author="adraken@yahoo.com" created="Sun, 27 Feb 2005 05:36:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=14369)&lt;br/&gt;
PATH_PATTERN allows empty paths. isValidPath() allows a trailing slash.&lt;br/&gt;
TestPairs updated to reflect changes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve been following this bug after trying to use the URL validator and noticing&lt;br/&gt;
that it is unusably strict. I finally decided to submit a patch since allowing&lt;br/&gt;
URLs of the form &quot;http://www.google.com&quot;, &quot;http://www.google.com/&quot;, and&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;http://www.google.com/apis/&quot; is necessary. They are almost universally&lt;br/&gt;
accepted as proper URLs. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as &amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt&quot;&amp;gt;RFC2396&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; is&lt;br/&gt;
concerned, Part 1.3 shows a trailing slash as being acceptable. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have obsoleted Tim Reilly&apos;s patches since this patch accomplishes the same&lt;br/&gt;
and more. In addition, there have since been changes made in the code that&lt;br/&gt;
conflict with his older patch.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12407262" author="martinc" created="Fri, 25 Mar 2005 10:01:48 +0000"  >&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-26] Validator declares illegal JavaScript variables</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-26</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I found a bug related validator.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JavaScript valiables that are made by Validator have name &lt;br/&gt;
like &quot;this.aa&quot;, &quot;this.ab&quot;. It seems to be OK.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When Validator declares &quot;this.do&quot;, &quot;this.if&quot;, &quot;this.in&quot; JavaScript compile &lt;br/&gt;
error occures .&lt;br/&gt;
Because &quot;do&quot;, &quot;if&quot;, &quot;in&quot; are reserved words in JavaScript.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;WindowsXP Professional Version 2002 Service Pack1:&lt;br/&gt;
IE 6.0.2800 SP1:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Manifest-Version: 1.0&lt;br/&gt;
Created-By: Apache Ant 1.5.1&lt;br/&gt;
Extension-Name: org.apache.commons.validator&lt;br/&gt;
Specification-Vendor: Apache Software Foundation&lt;br/&gt;
Specification-Version: 1.0&lt;br/&gt;
Implementation-Vendor: Apache Software Foundation&lt;br/&gt;
Implementation-Version: 1.0.2&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-25] [validator] maxlength on textarea in firefox the javascript doesn&apos;t match serverside</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-25</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using firefox with a textarea that has a maxlength, if you include carriage&lt;br/&gt;
returns in your data entry, the client side javascript will not match the server&lt;br/&gt;
side java. On the client side the javascript is only seeing a \n for the&lt;br/&gt;
carriage returns while on the server side the java is seeing a \n\r.  So if you&lt;br/&gt;
have a max length of 5, 1\n2\n3 will pass the client side, put fail the server&lt;br/&gt;
side since there is will be 1\n\r2\n\r3.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342805">VALIDATOR-25</key>
            <summary>[validator] maxlength on textarea in firefox the javascript doesn&apos;t match serverside</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="apache.9.alanf@antichef.net">Alan Olmanson</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 20 Dec 2005 03:26:20 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:01 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12411090" author="niallp" created="Mon, 9 Jan 2006 16:05:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have modified both the server side and client side validation so that &lt;br/&gt;
the &quot;line ending&quot; length can be specified for the min and max length &lt;br/&gt;
validators. The validators now &quot;adjust&quot; the value&apos;s length if a line ending &lt;br/&gt;
length is specified.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367226&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367226&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So for example, to treat line endings (either &quot;\n&quot; or &quot;\n\r&quot;) as a length of 1&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &amp;lt;field property=&quot;foo&quot; depends=&quot;required,minlength,maxlength&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;lineEndLength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;1&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;minlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;5&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;maxlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;20&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This will be available in the next nightly build:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, if your using this with Struts the Struts FieldChecks class needs to &lt;br/&gt;
be modified for the server side validation in Struts to work with this change. &lt;br/&gt;
Struts will be changed once the next release of Commons Validator has been &lt;br/&gt;
done. I have opened I have modified both the server side and client side validation so that &lt;br/&gt;
the &quot;line ending&quot; length can be specified for the min and max length &lt;br/&gt;
validators. The validators now &quot;adjust&quot; the value&apos;s length if a line ending &lt;br/&gt;
length is specified.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367226&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=367226&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So for example, to treat line endings (either &quot;\n&quot; or &quot;\n\r&quot;) as a length of 1&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &amp;lt;field property=&quot;foo&quot; depends=&quot;required,minlength,maxlength&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;lineEndLength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;1&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;minlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;5&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;maxlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;20&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This will be available in the next nightly build:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://cvs.apache.org/builds/jakarta-commons/nightly/commons-validator/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, if your using this with Struts the Struts FieldChecks class needs to &lt;br/&gt;
be modified for the server side validation in Struts to work with this change. &lt;br/&gt;
Struts will be changed once the next release of Commons Validator has been &lt;br/&gt;
done. I have opened Bug 38191 against Struts in order that it doesn&apos;t get &lt;br/&gt;
forgotten.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Closing this as FIXED against Struts in order that it doesn&apos;t get &lt;br/&gt;
forgotten.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Closing this as FIXED&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-24] Javascript validation doesn&apos;t work if a form field is called &quot;name&quot;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-24</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The last commit of the javascript code allows multiple forms on the same page &lt;br/&gt;
by generating a unique variable name based on form name, adding this line&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;oMinLength = eval(&apos;new &apos; + form.name + &apos;_minlength()&apos;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But if any field of the form is called &quot;name&quot; javascript validation doesn&apos;t &lt;br/&gt;
work as form.name is an object, not a String&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example &amp;lt;html:text property=&quot;name&quot;/&amp;gt; makes client side validation stop &lt;br/&gt;
working&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Affected files:&lt;br/&gt;
Jakarta-commons/validator/src/javascript/org/apache/commons/validator/javasc&lt;br/&gt;
ript/*.js&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341365">VALIDATOR-24</key>
            <summary>Javascript validation doesn&apos;t work if a form field is called &quot;name&quot;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="carlos">Carlos Sanchez Gonzalez</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 24 Mar 2004 18:34:08 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12406345" author="rleland" created="Thu, 25 Mar 2004 11:41:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This following snippet will fix the bug,I tested it on IE &amp;amp; Mozilla, &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Instead of:&lt;br/&gt;
   oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + form.name + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;br/&gt;
Use:&lt;br/&gt;
   var formName = null;&lt;br/&gt;
   for (var attribIndex = 0; (attribIndex &amp;lt; form.attributes.length) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;  &lt;br/&gt;
(formName == null); attribIndex++) {&lt;br/&gt;
           if (form.attributes&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;attribIndex&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.name == &quot;name&quot;) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                formName = form.attributes[attribIndex].value;
         }
&lt;p&gt;    }&lt;br/&gt;
oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + formName + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, it points out a weakness in Validators handling of javaScript in that&lt;br/&gt;
the snippet of code needs to be in a callable function. I could stick it in&lt;br/&gt;
one of the .js files like validateRequired.js but we need a better solution.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am crunched at work until Mid April, and if someone wants to just srick this &lt;br/&gt;
snippet in one of the .js files as a function thats ok by me.&lt;/p&gt;



</comment>
                            <comment id="12406346" author="rleland" created="Thu, 25 Mar 2004 12:59:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ok, This should be fixed in the Nightly build of Struts&lt;br/&gt;
given Craig rebuilds commons-validator tonight,&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;AND ***&lt;br/&gt;
You make sure to use the new validator-rules.xml file.&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I have only tested this last patch against Mozilla,&lt;br/&gt;
reopen the bug report if there is a problem with IE etc...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-23] Validator Range Checking Bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-23</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;See struts See struts bug 10191 for more details.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The original bug submitter suggested using doubles,&lt;br/&gt;
in the GenericValidator.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;public static boolean isInRange(int value, int min, int max) {&lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(double value, double min, double max) {&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;So doubles so could be compared&lt;br/&gt;
however on the Struts side it may be more useful to do&lt;br/&gt;
RTTI first on the Range objects and check for &lt;br/&gt;
Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double in that&lt;br/&gt;
in that order based on the Max, Min set, I am assuming they are&lt;br/&gt;
stored as Objects also ?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have never used the Validator framework myself&lt;br/&gt;
so I there could be more changes needed than&lt;br/&gt;
those above.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What do you think ? rleland@apache.org&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;So what I am requesting is a &lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(double value, double min, double max)&lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(short value, short min, short max) for more details.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The original bug submitter suggested using doubles,&lt;br/&gt;
in the GenericValidator.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;public static boolean isInRange(int value, int min, int max) {&lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(double value, double min, double max) {&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;So doubles so could be compared&lt;br/&gt;
however on the Struts side it may be more useful to do&lt;br/&gt;
RTTI first on the Range objects and check for &lt;br/&gt;
Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double in that&lt;br/&gt;
in that order based on the Max, Min set, I am assuming they are&lt;br/&gt;
stored as Objects also ?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have never used the Validator framework myself&lt;br/&gt;
so I there could be more changes needed than&lt;br/&gt;
those above.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What do you think ? rleland@apache.org&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;So what I am requesting is a &lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(double value, double min, double max)&lt;br/&gt;
+    public static boolean isInRange(short value, short min, short max)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-22] Validator incorrectly searching formsets by locale</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-22</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResources:get(String, String, String, &lt;br/&gt;
Object)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This method seems to be searching the hFormSet entries incorrectly for finding &lt;br/&gt;
a form with the given key, using a formset with the given locale.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The method bails out straight away if it does not find a formset with the &lt;br/&gt;
language + country + variant passed in, rather than trying&lt;br/&gt;
1) language + country + variant &lt;br/&gt;
2) language + country&lt;br/&gt;
3) language&lt;br/&gt;
4) default locale&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;The following diffs seem to fix it up, but I could be misunderstanding the &lt;br/&gt;
problem.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&amp;#8212; ValidatorResources.java	Wed Dec  4 02:27:36 2002&lt;br/&gt;
+++ /home/gf06866/projects/webATLAS/src/java/org/apache/commons/validator/Valida&lt;br/&gt;
torResources.java	Fri Dec 13 11:06:01 2002&lt;br/&gt;
@@ -244,63 +244,61 @@&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;/ol&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    */&lt;br/&gt;
     public Form get(String language, String country, String variant, Object &lt;br/&gt;
formKey) {&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;FormSet fs = null;&lt;br/&gt;
 	Form f = null;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;String key = null;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Object o = null;&lt;br/&gt;
-&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;key = ((language != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; language.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? language : &quot;&quot;) +&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;((country != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; country.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? &quot;_&quot; + country : &quot;&quot;) +&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;((variant != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; variant.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? &quot;_&quot; + variant : &quot;&quot;);&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Vector v = (Vector) hFormSets.get(key);&lt;br/&gt;
+	String localeKey = null;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if (v == null) return f;&lt;br/&gt;
-&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Enumeration formsets = v.elements();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;while (formsets.hasMoreElements()) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;o = formsets.nextElement();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if (o != null) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;fs = (FormSet)o;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if ((fs != null) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (fs.getForm(formKey) != null)) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;return fs.getForm(formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+	// Try language + country + variant&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(language) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
+		!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(country) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
+		!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(variant)) {&lt;br/&gt;
+		localeKey = language + &quot;&lt;em&gt;&quot; + country + &quot;&lt;/em&gt;&quot; + variant;&lt;br/&gt;
+		f = getForm(localeKey, formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+		if (f != null) 
&lt;div class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;Unknown macro: {+			if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
+				log.debug(&quot;Form with key &quot; + formKey + &quot; found 
in formset with locale &quot; + localeKey);
 		}&lt;br/&gt;
+			return f;&lt;br/&gt;
 	    }&lt;br/&gt;
 	}&lt;br/&gt;
-	key = ((language != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; language.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? language : &quot;&quot;) + &lt;br/&gt;
-	    ((country != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; country.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? &quot;_&quot; + country : &quot;&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
          &lt;br/&gt;
-	formsets = v.elements();&lt;br/&gt;
-	while (formsets.hasMoreElements()) {&lt;br/&gt;
-	    o = formsets.nextElement();&lt;br/&gt;
-	    if (o != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
-		fs = (FormSet)o;&lt;br/&gt;
-		if ((fs != null) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (fs.getForm(formKey) != null)) {&lt;br/&gt;
-		    return fs.getForm(formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+	// Try language + country&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(language) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
+		!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(country)) {&lt;br/&gt;
+		localeKey = language + &quot;_&quot; + country;&lt;br/&gt;
+		f = getForm(localeKey, formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+		if (f != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
+			if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {+				log.debug(&quot;Form with key &quot; + formKey + &quot; found in formset with locale &quot; + localeKey); 		}+			return f; 	    }&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt; 	}&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;key = ((language != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; language.length() &amp;gt; 0) ? language : &quot;&quot;);&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;formsets = v.elements();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;while (formsets.hasMoreElements()) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;o = formsets.nextElement();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if (o != null) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;fs = (FormSet)o;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if ((fs != null) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (fs.getForm(formKey) != null)) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;return fs.getForm(formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+&lt;br/&gt;
+	// Try language only&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (!GenericValidator.isBlankOrNull(language)) {&lt;br/&gt;
+		localeKey = language;&lt;br/&gt;
+		f = getForm(localeKey, formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+		if (f != null) 
&lt;div class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;Unknown macro: {+			if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
+				log.debug(&quot;Form with key &quot; + formKey + &quot; found 
in formset with locale &quot; + localeKey);
 		}+			return f; 	    }&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt; 	}&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;key = defaultLocale.toString();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;formsets = v.elements();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;while (formsets.hasMoreElements()) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;o = formsets.nextElement();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if (o != null) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;fs = (FormSet)o;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;if ((fs != null) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (fs.getForm(formKey) != null)) {&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;return fs.getForm(formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+&lt;br/&gt;
+	// Try default locale&lt;br/&gt;
+	localeKey = defaultLocale.toString();&lt;br/&gt;
+	f = getForm(localeKey, formKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (f != null) 
&lt;div class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;Unknown macro: {+		if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
+			log.debug(&quot;Form with key &quot; + formKey + &quot; found in 
formset with locale &quot; + localeKey);
 		}+		return f; 	    }&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;+&lt;br/&gt;
+	// No form found&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (log.isDebugEnabled()) &lt;/p&gt;
{
+			log.debug(&quot;No Form with key &quot; + formKey);
 	}
&lt;p&gt; 	return null;	&lt;br/&gt;
     }&lt;br/&gt;
@@ -425,5 +423,30 @@&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;       return field;  	&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;br/&gt;
+&lt;br/&gt;
+  /**&lt;br/&gt;
+   * Find a &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;FormSet&amp;lt;/code in the collection of stored formsets with the &lt;br/&gt;
given&lt;br/&gt;
+   * locale key, if a &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;FormSet&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; it found search it for a &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;code&amp;gt;Form&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
+   * with the given formKey&lt;br/&gt;
+   */&lt;br/&gt;
+  protected Form getForm(String localeKey, Object formKey) {&lt;br/&gt;
+	Object o = null;&lt;br/&gt;
+	Vector v = (Vector) hFormSets.get(localeKey);&lt;br/&gt;
+	FormSet fs = null;&lt;br/&gt;
+&lt;br/&gt;
+	if (v == null) return null;&lt;br/&gt;
+&lt;br/&gt;
+	Enumeration formsets = v.elements();&lt;br/&gt;
+	while (formsets.hasMoreElements()) {&lt;br/&gt;
+	    o = formsets.nextElement();&lt;br/&gt;
+	    if (o != null) {&lt;br/&gt;
+		    fs = (FormSet)o;&lt;br/&gt;
+		    if (fs.getForm(formKey) != null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
+		        return fs.getForm(formKey);
+		    }
&lt;p&gt;+	    }&lt;br/&gt;
+	}&lt;br/&gt;
+	return null;&lt;br/&gt;
+	}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; }&lt;/p&gt;</description>

                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>165847</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-21] Indexed properties not being set in ValidatorResults</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-21</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When Validator iterates over an indexed property, validating each value in turn,&lt;br/&gt;
it adds each result in the ValidatorResults under the original field&apos;s key&lt;br/&gt;
instead of doing it with the modified key corresponding to the slot in the&lt;br/&gt;
field. As a result, the values are overwritten.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See Validator.java, line 429 or thereabouts.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340460">VALIDATOR-21</key>
            <summary>Indexed properties not being set in ValidatorResults</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="matias@k-bell.com">Mat&#237;as Giovannini</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 16 Dec 2002 21:59:09 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403357" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Tue, 17 Dec 2002 04:58:11 +0000"  >
&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not so sure that this is a bug.  In most cases, an indexed property is &lt;br/&gt;
going to be used in a table-style of input with an iterator.  You wouldn&apos;t &lt;br/&gt;
want to display each error on the line, you&apos;d display them at the top.  If we &lt;br/&gt;
went to storing indexed property error messages on the full property with &lt;br/&gt;
index, you&apos;d need to put an iterator around bean:errors in Struts (for &lt;br/&gt;
example) to generate all the error messages.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Willing to hear counter arguments.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;James&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403358" author="matias@k-bell.com" created="Tue, 17 Dec 2002 05:14:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=4188)&lt;br/&gt;
Proposed fix&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403359" author="matias@k-bell.com" created="Tue, 17 Dec 2002 05:27:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Multiple errors get overwritten much as multiple return values do. Look in&lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorResult.java, line 117:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;      hResults.put(field.getKey(), result);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem is, both errors and values should be indexed in ValidatorResult;&lt;br/&gt;
with this modification, you have to manually construct the key (using&lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorUtils.replace()), but at least you don&apos;t lose info.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I confess I&apos;m not using Struts, but I&apos;m using Validator in standalone fashion,&lt;br/&gt;
so maybe my needs are very particular.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Mat&#237;as.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403360" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Mon, 20 Jan 2003 14:33:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We&apos;ll look at the issue for 1.1&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                            <attachment id="12332091" name="ASF.LICENSE.NOT.GRANTED--validator.patch.txt" size="534" author="matias@k-bell.com" created="Tue, 17 Dec 2002 05:14:03 +0000"/>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-20] [validator] validator argument - resource=&quot;false&quot; ignored</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-20</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In ValidationResources.java function addOldArgRules does not set value of&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;ldquo;resource&amp;rdquo;, like: &lt;br/&gt;
String resource = attributes.getValue(&quot;resource&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
if (resource != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !&quot;&quot;.equals(resource)) {&lt;br/&gt;
	arg.setResource(resource);&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;br/&gt;
As a result I&apos;ve got struts validation message &quot;Field can not be less than null&lt;br/&gt;
characters.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Because in config there is defined a value &apos;2&apos; for minlength, but commons.jar&lt;br/&gt;
searches for resource with name &apos;2&apos; in resource bundule.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Configuration:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;              &amp;lt;field property=&quot;name&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                     depends=&quot;required,minlength,maxlength&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                  &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;fieldForm.name&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;arg1&lt;br/&gt;
                      name=&quot;minlength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                    key=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                      resource=&quot;false&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;arg1&lt;br/&gt;
                      name=&quot;maxlength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                    key=&quot;${var:maxlength}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                      resource=&quot;false&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
                  /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;minlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;2&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;maxlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                    &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;4&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
                  &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
              &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342942">VALIDATOR-20</key>
            <summary>[validator] validator argument - resource=&quot;false&quot; ignored</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ros@ml.lv">Rostislav Palivoda</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 28 Feb 2006 03:03:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:00 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12411519" author="niallp" created="Tue, 28 Feb 2006 05:14:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have fixed this, thanks for reporting it:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=381425&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=381425&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This affects only the deprecared arg0 - arg3 elements. If you switch to the &lt;br/&gt;
newer &quot;arg&quot; format (available in the 1.1 dtd) then you shouldn&apos;t have any &lt;br/&gt;
problems:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;arg position=&quot;1&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
     name=&quot;minlength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
     key=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
     resource=&quot;false&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
 /&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12411520" author="ros@ml.lv" created="Tue, 28 Feb 2006 16:51:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I use Xdoclet to generate config file. In my case it&apos;s &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;@struts.validator type=&quot;minlength&quot; arg1value=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;@struts.validator-var name=&quot;minlength&quot; value=&quot;2&quot;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;How can I switch to the new format using XDoclet?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;  &amp;lt;arg position=&quot;1&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;      name=&quot;minlength&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;      key=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;      resource=&quot;false&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;  /&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12411521" author="niallp" created="Tue, 28 Feb 2006 20:38:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, I&apos;m not an XDoclet user - you&apos;ll have to ask XDoclet about this.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                            <comment id="12411672" author="hondams@nttdata.co.jp" created="Fri, 31 Mar 2006 08:55:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=18008)&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-18] [validator] Validation in MSIE5.0</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-18</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Version : commons-validator-1.2.0&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The validation in MSIE5.0 failed with errors like :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A Runtime error has occurred.&lt;br/&gt;
Do you wish to Debug ?&lt;br/&gt;
Line: 1361&lt;br/&gt;
Error: Expected &apos;;&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To solve this error I have changed the method retrieveFormName in&lt;br/&gt;
validateUtilities.js from :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;function retrieveFormName(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
  // Please refer to Bugs 31534, 35127, 35294 &amp;amp; 37315&lt;br/&gt;
  // for the history of the following code&lt;br/&gt;
  if (form.getAttributeNode) {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value) &lt;/p&gt;
{
        return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value;
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
        return form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).value;
     }
&lt;p&gt;  } else if (form.getAttribute) {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
        return form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
        form.attributes[&quot;name&quot;];
     }
&lt;p&gt;  } else {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.id) &lt;/p&gt;
{
        return form.id;
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
        return form.name;
     }
&lt;p&gt;  }&lt;br/&gt;
}  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;to&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;function retrieveFormName(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
  var x;&lt;br/&gt;
  if (form.getAttributeNode) {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value) &lt;/p&gt;
{
        x = form.getAttributeNode(&quot;id&quot;).value;
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
       x = form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;).value;
     }
&lt;p&gt;  } else if (form.getAttribute) {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
       x = form.getAttribute(&quot;name&quot;);
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
       x =  form.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);
     }
&lt;p&gt;  } else {&lt;br/&gt;
     if (form.id) &lt;/p&gt;
{
       x =  form.id;
     }
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
       x =  form.name;
    }
&lt;p&gt;  }&lt;br/&gt;
  return x;&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This solution is tested on : &lt;br/&gt;
FireFox 1.5&lt;br/&gt;
MSIE 5.00.3502.1000&lt;br/&gt;
MSIE 6.0.2900.xpsp_sp2_gdr.050301-1519&lt;br/&gt;
Netscape 8.0.4&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regrads &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Kristian L. Petesen&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342842">VALIDATOR-18</key>

                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

appears to work fine.&lt;/p&gt;

            <title>[VALIDATOR-17] &lt;msg resource=&quot;false&quot;&gt; does not work</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-17</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the version of the validator that ships with struts 1.1, &lt;br/&gt;
I can get a custom error message using the msg tag nested &lt;br/&gt;
inside a field tag, but I have to use the properties file.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s as though reource was always = true &amp;#8211; I cannot hard-code &lt;br/&gt;
the message text in the validation.xml file.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-16] ValidatorAction class issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-16</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m currently using commons-validator 1.1.1 in a Java Web Start client bundled&lt;br/&gt;
with jre 1.4.2.&lt;br/&gt;
Whenever using a JNLP file to download the application, commons-validator hangs&lt;br/&gt;
in ValidatorAction class and to be more precise, it hangs in readJavascriptFile&lt;br/&gt;
method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Debugging that method I found a while loop that reads a javascript resource&lt;br/&gt;
based on InputStream.available() and InputStream.read() methods.&lt;br/&gt;
It seems that inside a Web Start environment, available() method always returns&lt;br/&gt;
a positive number while read() method is returning a negative number (-1) which&lt;br/&gt;
leads to a infinite loop.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That doesn&apos;t happen using a regular jar or class file to kick off the&lt;br/&gt;
application. I really don&apos;t know why this happens in Web Start environment but&lt;br/&gt;
either way, I&apos;ve listened that InputStream.available() is not a very trusted&lt;br/&gt;
method. Does it make sense?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve also downloaded commons-validator 1.1.2 but it has the same issue.&lt;br/&gt;
I&apos;ve also tested Java Web Start bundled with jre 1.5 beta - it does not hang in&lt;br/&gt;
this environment.&lt;br/&gt;
The same behavior happens in a W2K/XP box as in a Mandrake Linux box.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Mike&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341395">VALIDATOR-16</key>
            <summary>ValidatorAction class issue</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="mike@summa-tech.com">Liaw Mike</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 7 Apr 2004 19:07:55 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:56 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:56 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.1.1 (alpha)</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12406419" author="mike@summa-tech.com" created="Wed, 7 Apr 2004 19:09:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=11167)&lt;br/&gt;
patch for working around this bug&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406420" author="rleland" created="Sat, 10 Apr 2004 14:14:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I did a Google using:&lt;br/&gt;
Web Start InputStream &quot;Thread currentThread getContextClassLoader&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It seems you are not alone, there has to be a workaround out there&lt;br/&gt;
for this 1.4.2 bug.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406421" author="rleland" created="Sat, 10 Apr 2004 14:26:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Right now I am not inclined to use the patch, since it leaves you without a &lt;br/&gt;
functioning validator. A True Workaround this JWS  bug (See below) is to load&lt;br/&gt;
the validator-rules.xml of struts with the javascript functiion definitions,&lt;br/&gt;
like it use to be for validator 1.02 then the jar resources probably won&apos;t be &lt;br/&gt;
searched for.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I did a Google &quot;read currentThread getContextClassLoader&quot;&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
and found many messages about this JWS bug,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In particular see:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp?thread=490982&amp;amp;forum=10&amp;amp;message=2310036&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp?thread=490982&amp;amp;forum=10&amp;amp;message=2310036&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
and I quote from the bottom of that message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have not heard from Sun since I last entered it as a bug, but I found out &lt;br/&gt;
that icons as well as other resources fail to load from a jar file when an &lt;br/&gt;
application is run using Java Web Start version 1.4+ under JRE version 1.3 to &lt;br/&gt;
1.3.1_07.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, if newer versions of JRE starting with 1.3.1_09 is used to run the &lt;br/&gt;
application all resources can be loaded from the jar file successfully.&lt;br/&gt;
So, it is really a combination of Web Start vs JRE which causes this ambiguous &lt;br/&gt;
behaviour to show up.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;d be happy to apply a patch that worked around this bug yielding a functional&lt;br/&gt;
Validator, that reads the definitions from the jar. Short of that I am closing &lt;br/&gt;
this bug ticket.&lt;br/&gt;
Hope the info above helps you out !&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406422" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Sun, 11 Apr 2004 04:03:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Reopening to mark fixed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12406423" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Sun, 11 Apr 2004 04:04:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I just committed a change that simplifies the file reading and should fix this&lt;br/&gt;
problem because it doesn&apos;t use available() or read().&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

            <title>[VALIDATOR-15] GenericValidator.isEmail() fails for address &quot;toto@web.de./de&quot;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-15</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;toto@web.de./de should not be accepted as a valid email address but the&lt;br/&gt;
validator returns true (I guess it comes from the &quot;/&quot; that is the regexp delim)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-14] Validator.validate() exception handling for ValidatorException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-14</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If a validator method throws a ValidatorException, the expected behavior is &lt;br/&gt;
that Validator.validate() will rethrow the exception.  The actual behavior is &lt;br/&gt;
that a &quot;false&quot; is returned instead.  This masks exceptions as rule failures.   &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Users of the framework need to be able to distinguish between failure to pass a &lt;br/&gt;
validation rule versus an exception that occurs while executing a rule.  &lt;br/&gt;
Failure to pass validation is a &quot;normal&quot; occurrance that is correctible by &lt;br/&gt;
changing the data.  An exception that occurs while executing a rule is not &lt;br/&gt;
normal, could be caused by a configuration problem or other system problem, and &lt;br/&gt;
cannot be corrected by corrections to the data.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341072">VALIDATOR-14</key>
            <summary>Validator.validate() exception handling for ValidatorException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="janet.moyer@ibx.com">Janet Moyer</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 4 Nov 2003 06:40:01 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 16 May 2006 12:32:56 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 16 May 2006 12:32:56 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12405389" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 01:56:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Validator.getIndexedProperty() looks like the only method that generates &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorExceptions.  Validator.executeValidationMethod() catches Exception; if &lt;br/&gt;
it&apos;s a ValidatorException it rethrows it, else it returns false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Maybe this is a problem that was fixed after 1.0.2.  You could try a nightly &lt;br/&gt;
build to see if that fixes it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405390" author="amamment" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 02:08:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I include below a portion of Janet Moyer&apos;s message which I consider essential &lt;br/&gt;
for this discussion.  The core of the issue is not the masking of &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorExceptions raised by the validation framework, but whether or not &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorExceptions ought to be raised by the validation rule implementations &lt;br/&gt;
themselves.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Janet&apos;s requirements is that some means of notification regarding system level &lt;br/&gt;
errors (not invalid data - currently handled in a usable fashion by the &lt;br/&gt;
framework - but inability to validate the data - currently masked as &lt;br/&gt;
equivalent to invalid data) is required.  A reasonable means of doing this &lt;br/&gt;
seems to be for validation rule implementations to throw ValidatorException.  &lt;br/&gt;
However, because the rule methods are invoked using reflection, these &lt;br/&gt;
exceptions are wrapped into InvocationTargetException.  The framework &lt;br/&gt;
currently makes no effort to unwrap these exceptions and examine them to &lt;br/&gt;
determine whether or not they are ValidatorExceptions.  (The catch clause &lt;br/&gt;
David points out should do this, if it is to be done.)  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Assuming this is appropriate behaviour, I&apos;ll attach a patch shortly.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;----&lt;del&gt;Original Message&lt;/del&gt;----&lt;br/&gt;
From: Moyer, Janet &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;mailto:Janet.Moyer@ibx.com&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Janet.Moyer@ibx.com&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/mail_small.gif&quot; height=&quot;12&quot; width=&quot;13&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;br/&gt;
Sent: Monday, November 10, 2003 9:05 AM&lt;br/&gt;
To: &apos;commons-dev@jakarta.apache.org&apos;&lt;br/&gt;
Subject: Commons Validator Limitation&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;SNIP /&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The problem we have is in how the Validator handles exceptions.  Our rules &lt;br/&gt;
access databases and backend systems for data needed during validation. If a &lt;br/&gt;
system problem occurs, such as a database is down, our rules try to throw a &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorException. Since the plugin methods are invoked by reflection, our &lt;br/&gt;
exceptions are wrapped in InvocationTargetExceptions. Validator.validate() &lt;br/&gt;
treats this as a validator error rather than a ValidatorException.  This means &lt;br/&gt;
all our system exceptions are treated the same as data problems.  For example, &lt;br/&gt;
we have a rule that validates a duplicate add of a customer account.  The &lt;br/&gt;
validation plugin reads a database to check whether the account exists.  The &lt;br/&gt;
problem is that if the database is down, the Validator.validate() masks the &lt;br/&gt;
exception, and tells us that the account already exists.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;SNIP /&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405391" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 02:22:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The exception handling in Validator.executeValidationMethod() needs to be &lt;br/&gt;
cleaned up anyways.  I&apos;m not a big fan of that instanceof check in the &quot;catch &lt;br/&gt;
Exception&quot; block.  I agree that we should unwrap InvocationTargetExceptions and &lt;br/&gt;
rethrow them if they&apos;re ValidatorExceptions.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405392" author="amamment" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 03:11:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Well,  I&apos;m about to attach two patches.  The first is for the test cases, to &lt;br/&gt;
generate exceptions during the test process.  The second, of course, is for &lt;br/&gt;
the source, to &quot;properly&quot; handle those exceptions.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The assumptions I made:&lt;br/&gt;
1) Validator.validate SHOULD ONLY return false if the data proved to be &lt;br/&gt;
invalid, not if there was an exception in the process of validating the data.&lt;br/&gt;
2) Runtime exceptions are propagated as is.  &lt;br/&gt;
3) ValidatorExceptions are propagated as is.&lt;br/&gt;
4) Other checked exceptions are transformed to ValidatorExceptions&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I wasn&apos;t able to remove instanceof checks completely - I have to use them when &lt;br/&gt;
examining the &quot;TargetException&quot; wrapped by the InvocationTargetException.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Take a look....&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405393" author="amamment" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 03:12:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9030)&lt;br/&gt;
Testcase to generate exceptions during validation and check handling&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405394" author="amamment" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 03:12:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9031)&lt;br/&gt;
Code change to handle exceptions generated during validation&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405395" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 11 Nov 2003 03:32:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree with the proposed approach but it is an incompatible behavior change.  &lt;br/&gt;
The problem is that Validator was initially written without much regard to &lt;br/&gt;
RuntimeExceptions.  We have done much to improve the situation but there may be &lt;br/&gt;
places in the code where RuntimExceptions are known to be thrown and caught by &lt;br/&gt;
the generic &quot;catch Exception&quot; block to be translated as a failure.  For example, &lt;br/&gt;
a piece of code was throwing NullPointerException that wasn&apos;t noticed because of &lt;br/&gt;
a &quot;catch Exception&quot; block.  After discovering and fixing this, performance &lt;br/&gt;
improved by 50%.  IMO, a thorough analysis of the exception situation in &lt;br/&gt;
Validator is needed before making this change.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405396" author="janet.moyer@ibx.com" created="Tue, 25 Nov 2003 01:34:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand that the suggested approach would create an incompatible behavior &lt;br/&gt;
change.  A more thorough analysis of exception handling may take a while to &lt;br/&gt;
complete. Could we consider changing the assumptions a bit to accommodate an &lt;br/&gt;
interim solution, as in the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;1) ValidatorExceptions are propagated as is.&lt;br/&gt;
2) Other exceptions continue to work as they do now - i.e., they return false.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405397" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Tue, 25 Nov 2003 02:40:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sounds good to me.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405398" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Sun, 18 Jan 2004 06:01:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed.  In Validator 2.0 I&apos;d like to change the framework&apos;s exception handling &lt;br/&gt;
so that pluggable validation methods don&apos;t have to wrap &quot;system&quot; exceptions in &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorExceptions.  They could just throw SQLException, IOException, etc. to &lt;br/&gt;
make their implementation easier.  Thanks for the patch!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405399" author="janet.moyer@ibx.com" created="Tue, 3 Feb 2004 03:05:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand, from David Graham&apos;s comments on 2004-01-17 that this bug was &lt;br/&gt;
fixed.  Where might I download this fix?  Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310420" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank">

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-13] If two fields are required, and one has a mask, the mask is not checked if the other field is blank</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-13</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;You have two validated fields in a form, both of which have &quot;required&quot; as a &lt;br/&gt;
validation, and one of which has a mask as a validation.  The one which is &lt;br/&gt;
only required is field2, the one with &quot;required,mask&quot; is field1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If field2 is blank and field1 has a value that fails the mask, no error is &lt;br/&gt;
generated for field1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If field2 is non-blank, field1 is validated properly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TEST CASE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you put the following in struts-config:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;form-bean name=&quot;testForm&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
type=&quot;org.apache.struts.validator.DynaValidatorForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;form-property name=&quot;field1&quot; type=&quot;java.lang.String&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;form-property name=&quot;field2&quot; type=&quot;java.lang.String&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/form-bean&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;action type=&quot;&amp;lt;someaction&amp;gt;&quot; name=&quot;testForm&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
path=&quot;/testAction&quot; input=&quot;/testAction.jsp&quot; validate=&quot;true&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And the following in your validation.xml&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;form name=&quot;testForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;field&lt;br/&gt;
     property=&quot;field1&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
     depends=&quot;required,mask&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
     &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;mask&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;^&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;a-z&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
     &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;field&lt;br/&gt;
     property=&quot;field2&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
     depends=&quot;required&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;And testAction.jsp has:&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;%@ page language=&quot;java&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;%@ taglib uri=&quot;/WEB-INF/struts-bean.tld&quot; prefix=&quot;bean&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;%@ taglib uri=&quot;/WEB-INF/struts-html.tld&quot; prefix=&quot;html&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;%@ taglib uri=&quot;/WEB-INF/struts-logic.tld&quot; prefix=&quot;logic&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;%@ taglib uri=&quot;/WEB-INF/struts-template.tld&quot; prefix=&quot;tmp&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;html:errors/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;html:form action=&quot;/testAction&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Field 1: &amp;lt;html:text property=&quot;field1&quot;/&amp;gt;&amp;lt;BR&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Field 2: &amp;lt;html:text property=&quot;field2&quot;/&amp;gt;&amp;lt;BR&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;html:submit/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/html:form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340266">VALIDATOR-13</key>
            <summary>If two fields are required, and one has a mask, the mask is not checked if the other field is blank</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="turner@blackbear.com">James Turner</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 14 Jul 2002 05:30:25 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:56 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:56 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12402751" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Sun, 14 Jul 2002 10:34:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=2348)&lt;br/&gt;
Fixed this, probably a number of other validator bugs, ground-up refactoring to validate()&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12402752" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Sun, 14 Jul 2002 10:35:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=2349)&lt;br/&gt;
Fixed this, probably a number of other validator bugs, ground-up refactoring to validate()&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12402753" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Sun, 14 Jul 2002 10:53:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There have been a number of bugs posted against Validator.java (including one &lt;br/&gt;
by me), so I thought I&apos;d take a crack at fixing it.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;As written, all the VAs were run against the fields if the field had a &lt;br/&gt;
dependency, except that a VA wasn&apos;t run if it had a failed dependency itself.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, that meant that if field A depended on &quot;required&quot;, and field B &lt;br/&gt;
dependended on &quot;required, mask&quot;, B&apos;s &quot;mask&quot; would never be run if field A was &lt;br/&gt;
blank, even if field B wasn&apos;t blank.  There were some other similar problems.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Anyway, I refactored it as follows:  The top level iterates over the fields.  &lt;br/&gt;
Each field then has it&apos;s dependencies run (and the depencies of the &lt;br/&gt;
dependencies recursively, etc...)  At the first failure, the ValidatorResult &lt;br/&gt;
that failed is added to the master results list, and the main loop moves on to &lt;br/&gt;
the next field.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I think things are a bit easier to follow in the source now, and the main &lt;br/&gt;
validate() isn&apos;t so huge, but that&apos;s just my preferences.  Could someone take &lt;br/&gt;
a peek and let me know if you see any obvious problems, and commit it if it&apos;s &lt;br/&gt;
OK?&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Thanks,&lt;br/&gt;
James&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12402754" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Fri, 11 Oct 2002 08:03:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Gee, I get to close my own bug.  Fixed in the Great Refactoring of September.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                            <attachment id="12331987" name="ASF.LICENSE.NOT.GRANTED--Validator.java.diff" size="16822" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Sun, 14 Jul 2002 10:34:50 +0000"/>
                            <attachment id="12331988" name="ASF.LICENSE.NOT.GRANTED--ValidatorResults.java.diff" size="1054" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Sun, 14 Jul 2002 10:35:26 +0000"/>
