            <title>[VALIDATOR-12] [validator] Error in catching exception and checking instanceof</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-12</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In class Validator method validateFieldForRule you use reflection whitch throw &lt;br/&gt;
InvocationtargetException and you catch all Exception and check if its instance &lt;br/&gt;
of ValidatorException since you will get a InvocationTargetException which has &lt;br/&gt;
the real exception the if is useless. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  private boolean validateFieldForRule(&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; } catch (Exception e) {&lt;br/&gt;
            log.error(&quot;reflection: &quot; + e.getMessage(), e);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            results.add(field, va.getName(), false);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;--------&amp;gt;&amp;gt;  if (e instanceof ValidatorException) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                throw ((ValidatorException) e);
            }&lt;br/&gt;
            return false;&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        return true;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
va.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: &lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorException: Erreur lors du transport &lt;br/&gt;
Exception :Can&apos;t connect to the Entitlements Server.&lt;br/&gt;
	at com.lq.clubvip.web.validations.Validation.validerCodeUsagerInutilise&lt;br/&gt;
(Validation.java:1469)&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
} catch (Exception e) {&lt;br/&gt;
            log.error(&quot;reflection: &quot; + e.getMessage(), e);&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
            results.add(field, va.getName(), false);&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
--------&amp;gt;&amp;gt;  if (((java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException)&lt;br/&gt;
e).getTargetException() instanceof ValidatorException) {                throw ((ValidatorException) e);            }
&lt;p&gt;            return false;&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        return true;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-11] Multiple field elements with same property value not validated</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-11</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When defining a validations.xml doc, I&apos;ve come across the problem that field &lt;br/&gt;
elements with the same property value will not be returned in the &lt;br/&gt;
ValidatorResults when the validation fails. For instance, if within ur &lt;br/&gt;
validations.xml you&apos;ve defined the following....&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;form name=&quot;aForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;field property=&quot;field1&quot;  depends=&quot;dependecy1&quot; /&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;field property=&quot;field1&quot;  depends=&quot;dependecy2&quot; /&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If both validations fail, the ValidatorResults will only contain the failure &lt;br/&gt;
related to dependecy2  event though validation methods corresponding to &lt;br/&gt;
dependecy1 and  dependecy2 are called. Is this by design? Should u define &lt;br/&gt;
multiple field elements with the same property value?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thx&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340582">VALIDATOR-11</key>
            <summary>Multiple field elements with same property value not validated</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="efarish@randomwalk.com">Eric Farish</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 5 Mar 2003 03:52:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:55 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 22 Nov 2006 22:44:38 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                    <component>Framework</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403774" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Wed, 5 Mar 2003 04:04:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You need to define it as:&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;field property=&quot;field1&quot;  depends=&quot;dependency1,dependency2&quot; /&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403775" author="efarish@randomwalk.com" created="Wed, 5 Mar 2003 07:39:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;But what if you want to use the same dependency with different arguments, for &lt;br/&gt;
instance:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;form name=&quot;aForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;field property=&quot;field1&quot;  depends=&quot;dependecy1&quot; &amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;paramName&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;value1&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/var&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;field property=&quot;field1&quot;  depends=&quot;dependecy1&quot; &amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;paramName&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;value2&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/var&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-eric&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403776" author="dgraham@apache.org" created="Wed, 12 Mar 2003 23:44:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This will be a usage restriction for now.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-8] validateFloat method result in error when verify the number 0.9</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-8</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The validateFloat() method said 0.9 is not a float number.&lt;br/&gt;
I had check the source,the code in isAllDigits() method which called by &lt;br/&gt;
validateFloat() have a bug.&lt;br/&gt;
I think this &lt;br/&gt;
validChars = &quot;01234567&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
should be &lt;br/&gt;
validChars = &quot;0123456789&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341736">VALIDATOR-8</key>
            <summary>validateFloat method result in error when verify the number 0.9</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="superbible_cs@163.com">superbible</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 21 Sep 2004 12:44:58 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:55 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:55 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.1.1 (alpha)</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12407613" author="mac@apache.org" created="Tue, 21 Sep 2004 14:09:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If you have a closer look to the code you&apos;ll notice that isAllDigits is&lt;br/&gt;
performing well. You use base 10 as default. If you have 0x at the beginning the&lt;br/&gt;
number is hexadecimal if it starts with 0 it will be in octal form.&lt;br/&gt;
validateFloat() always returns true for a field with value &quot;0.9&quot; (at least in&lt;br/&gt;
cvs-head). &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        var validChars = &quot;0123456789&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
        var startFrom = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
        if (argvalue.substring(0, 2) == &quot;0x&quot;) &lt;/p&gt;
{
           validChars = &quot;0123456789abcdefABCDEF&quot;;
           startFrom = 2;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else if (argvalue.charAt(0) == &quot;0&quot;) &lt;/p&gt;
{
           validChars = &quot;01234567&quot;;
           startFrom = 1;
        }
&lt;p&gt; else if (argvalue.charAt(0) == &quot;-&quot;) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            startFrom = 1;
        }</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-7] [validator] Collision between Prototype.js and Validator</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-7</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I&apos;am using prototype.js in conjunction with the validator but I am facing the&lt;br/&gt;
following problem,&lt;br/&gt;
this library adds a field called &quot;extends&quot; to objects so code like:&lt;br/&gt;
&quot;for (var x in oRequired)&quot; (same for all validators) &lt;br/&gt;
will field &apos;extends&apos; (assigned to x) and oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; will be undefined&lt;br/&gt;
breaking the rest.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I will submit a patch for this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342729">VALIDATOR-7</key>
            <summary>[validator] Collision between Prototype.js and Validator</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg">Blocker</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com">Philippe Mouawad</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 23 Nov 2005 04:03:16 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 2 May 2013 02:28:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:55 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12410913" author="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com" created="Wed, 23 Nov 2005 04:06:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=17013)&lt;br/&gt;
Patch to version 1.1.4 containing correction to JS files&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue is in the JS files of the library.&lt;br/&gt;
Here are the correction made on the Javascript files:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Scope too large for your variables:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;oCreditCard, oByte,oDate&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Replaced == true by === true, same for == 0&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;parse&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/error.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; replaced by parse(x, 10)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I&apos;am using prototype.js in conjunction with the validator but I am facing the&lt;br/&gt;
following problem,&lt;br/&gt;
this library adds a field extends to objects so for (var x in oRequired) will&lt;br/&gt;
iterate over 4 fields instead of 3&lt;br/&gt;
and encounter x = &apos;extends&apos; and oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; will be undefined breaking the&lt;br/&gt;
rest.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What I did was to add matchValidationVariable () function with the following&lt;br/&gt;
code that checks that the variable&lt;br/&gt;
oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;  is not undefined and that the name of x matches your variable&lt;br/&gt;
names (&apos;^a&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0-9&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;*$&apos;):&lt;br/&gt;
  function matchValidationVariable(variable, value)&lt;/p&gt;
  {
		  var theRegexp = new RegExp(&apos;^a[0-9]*$&apos;);
		  return ((typeof value[0] !== undefined) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;
			  (theRegexp.exec(variable) !== null));
  }</comment>
                            <comment id="12410914" author="p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com" created="Wed, 23 Nov 2005 04:08:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=17014)&lt;br/&gt;
Modifications to version 1.1.4 (JS files)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here are the correction made on your Javascript:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Scope too large for your variables:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;oCreditCard, oByte,oDate&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Replaced == true by === true, same for == 0&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;parse&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/error.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; replaced by parse(x, 10)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I&apos;am using prototype.js in conjunction with the validator but I am facing the&lt;br/&gt;
following problem,&lt;br/&gt;
this library adds a field extends to objects so for (var x in oRequired) will&lt;br/&gt;
iterate over 4 fields instead of 3&lt;br/&gt;
and encounter x = &apos;extends&apos; and oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; will be undefined breaking the&lt;br/&gt;
rest.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What I did was to add matchValidationVariable () function with the following&lt;br/&gt;
code that checks that the variable&lt;br/&gt;
oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;  is not undefined and that the name of x matches your variable&lt;br/&gt;
names (&apos;^a&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0-9&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;*$&apos;):&lt;br/&gt;
  function matchValidationVariable(variable, value)&lt;/p&gt;
  {
		  var theRegexp = new RegExp(&apos;^a[0-9]*$&apos;);
		  return ((typeof value[0] !== undefined) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;
			  (theRegexp.exec(variable) !== null));
  }</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-6] [validator] validateRequired on a single radio button</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-6</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When I apply the required validation rule to a single radio button, then &lt;br/&gt;
javascript validation passes when it should fail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please find herewith enclosed a version that fixes things up in my case:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    function validateRequired(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
        var isValid = true;&lt;br/&gt;
        var focusField = null;&lt;br/&gt;
        var i = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
        var fields = new Array();&lt;br/&gt;
        var formName = form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + formName.value + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        for (x in oRequired) {&lt;br/&gt;
            var field = form[oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;];&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            if ((field.type == &apos;hidden&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;text&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;textarea&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;file&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;radio&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;checkbox&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;select-one&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                field.type == &apos;password&apos;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                field.disabled == false) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                var value = &apos;&apos;;&lt;br/&gt;
                // get field&apos;s value&lt;br/&gt;
                if (field.type == &quot;select-one&quot;) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    var si = field.selectedIndex;&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (si &amp;gt;= 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        value = field.options[si].value;
                    }
&lt;p&gt;                } else if (field.type == &apos;radio&apos; || field.type == &apos;checkbox&apos;) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (field.checked) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        value = field.value;
                    }
&lt;p&gt;                } else &lt;/p&gt;
{
                    value = field.value;
                }

&lt;p&gt;                if (trim(value).length == 0) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                    if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        focusField = field;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                    fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                    isValid = false;&lt;br/&gt;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
            } else if (field.type == &quot;select-multiple&quot;) { &lt;br/&gt;
                var numOptions = field.options.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                lastSelected=-1;&lt;br/&gt;
                for(loop=numOptions-1;loop&amp;gt;=0;loop--) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    if(field.options&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;loop&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.selected) {
                        lastSelected = loop;
                        value = field.options[loop].value;
                        break;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
                if(lastSelected &amp;lt; 0 || trim(value).length == 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    if(i == 0) {                        focusField = field;                    }
&lt;p&gt;                    fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                    isValid=false;&lt;br/&gt;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
            } else if ((field.length &amp;gt; 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (field&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.type == &apos;radio&apos; || field&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.type == &apos;checkbox&apos;)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                isChecked=-1;&lt;br/&gt;
                for (loop=0;loop &amp;lt; field.length;loop++) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (field&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;loop&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.checked) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        isChecked=loop;
                        break; // only one needs to be checked
                    }
&lt;p&gt;                }&lt;br/&gt;
                if (isChecked &amp;lt; 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        focusField = field[0];
                    }
&lt;p&gt;                    fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                    isValid=false;&lt;br/&gt;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
            }&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        if (fields.length &amp;gt; 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
           focusField.focus();
           alert(fields.join(&apos;\n&apos;));
        }
&lt;p&gt;        return isValid;&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341992">VALIDATOR-6</key>
            <summary>[validator] validateRequired on a single radio button</summary>

                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

                            <comment id="12408536" author="mac@apache.org" created="Wed, 12 Jan 2005 17:15:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I know I am repeating myself, but I think it is important to properly address&lt;br/&gt;
the client-side validation problem. I think #32873 is a good starting point for&lt;br/&gt;
solving all these problems (and future ones that will surely come). Unless we&lt;br/&gt;
all agree with a &quot;js field values grabbing framework&quot; it is just a matter of&lt;br/&gt;
time that new validators will fail with radios and checkboxes.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12408537" author="mrdon" created="Wed, 24 Aug 2005 13:12:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in changeset &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;239522&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.  Thanks for the patch!  And I do agree with Nacho&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-5] [validator] Javascript error when validating a null hidden field</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-5</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;br/&gt;
I have the following javascript error when I try to validate an hidden field &lt;br/&gt;
which value is null : &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;input type=&quot;hidden&quot; name=&quot;foo&quot; value=&quot;&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;Error: Can&apos;t move focus to the control because it is invisible, not enalbed, &lt;br/&gt;
or of a type that does not accept foucs.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Works if I have : &amp;lt;input type=&quot;hidden&quot; name=&quot;foo&quot; value=&quot;foo_value&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(It use to work with Struts 1.1)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks !&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342026">VALIDATOR-5</key>
            <summary>[validator] Javascript error when validating a null hidden field</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="5">Cannot Reproduce</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="juliegautier@yahoo.fr">Julie Gautier</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 1 Feb 2005 21:45:03 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12408642" author="gregory.le.bonniec@freesbee.fr" created="Mon, 6 Jun 2005 17:12:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(In reply to comment #0)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Hi,&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; I have the following javascript error when I try to validate an hidden field &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; which value is null : &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &amp;lt;input type=&quot;hidden&quot; name=&quot;foo&quot; value=&quot;&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &quot;Error: Can&apos;t move focus to the control because it is invisible, not enalbed, &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; or of a type that does not accept foucs.&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Works if I have : &amp;lt;input type=&quot;hidden&quot; name=&quot;foo&quot; value=&quot;foo_value&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; (It use to work with Struts 1.1)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt; Thanks !&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the problem is that validateRequired put the focus on the hidden field which is&lt;br/&gt;
forbidden in IE.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;so we can avoid this problem like this :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    function validateRequired(form) {&lt;br/&gt;
        var isValid = true;&lt;br/&gt;
        var focusField = null;&lt;br/&gt;
        var i = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
        var fields = new Array();&lt;br/&gt;
        var formName = form.getAttributeNode(&quot;name&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        oRequired = eval(&apos;new &apos; + formName.value + &apos;_required()&apos;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        for (x in oRequired) {&lt;br/&gt;
            var field = form[oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;];&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            if (field) {&lt;br/&gt;
                if ((field.type == &apos;hidden&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;text&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;textarea&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;file&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;checkbox&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;select-one&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.type == &apos;password&apos;) &amp;amp;&amp;amp;&lt;br/&gt;
                    field.disabled == false) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;                    var value = &apos;&apos;;&lt;br/&gt;
                    // get field&apos;s value&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (field.type == &quot;select-one&quot;) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        var si = field.selectedIndex;&lt;br/&gt;
                        if (si &amp;gt;= 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                            value = field.options[si].value;
                        }
&lt;p&gt;                    } else if (field.type == &apos;checkbox&apos;) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if (field.checked) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                            value = field.value;
                        }
&lt;p&gt;                    } else &lt;/p&gt;
{
                        value = field.value;
                    }

&lt;p&gt;                    if (trim(value).length == 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if ((i == 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (field.type != &apos;hidden&apos;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                            focusField = field;
                        }&lt;br/&gt;
                        fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                        isValid = false;&lt;br/&gt;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                } else if (field.type == &quot;select-multiple&quot;) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    var numOptions = field.options.length;&lt;br/&gt;
                    lastSelected=-1;&lt;br/&gt;
                    for(loop=numOptions-1;loop&amp;gt;=0;loop--) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if(field.options&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;loop&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.selected) {
                            lastSelected = loop;
                            value = field.options[loop].value;
                            break;
                        }&lt;br/&gt;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                    if(lastSelected &amp;lt; 0 || trim(value).length == 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if(i == 0) {                            focusField = field;                        }
&lt;p&gt;                        fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                        isValid=false;&lt;br/&gt;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                } else if ((field.length &amp;gt; 0) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (field&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.type == &apos;radio&apos; ||&lt;br/&gt;
field&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.type == &apos;checkbox&apos;)) {&lt;br/&gt;
                    isChecked=-1;&lt;br/&gt;
                    for (loop=0;loop &amp;lt; field.length;loop++) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if (field&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;loop&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.checked) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                            isChecked=loop;
                            break; // only one needs to be checked
                        }
&lt;p&gt;                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                    if (isChecked &amp;lt; 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
                        if (i == 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
                            focusField = field[0];
                        }
&lt;p&gt;                        fields&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i++&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = oRequired&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
                        isValid=false;&lt;br/&gt;
                    }&lt;br/&gt;
                }&lt;br/&gt;
           }&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        if (fields.length &amp;gt; 0) {&lt;br/&gt;
           if (focusField != null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
               focusField.focus();
           }
&lt;p&gt;           alert(fields.join(&apos;\n&apos;));&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        return isValid;&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12408643" author="mrdon" created="Wed, 24 Aug 2005 13:13:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I believe this has been solved as it seems to work for me.  Let me know if your&lt;br/&gt;
experience is different by reopening the ticket.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

            <title>[VALIDATOR-4] [validator] Client-side javascript fails to parse e-mail addresses for .info domains</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-4</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using domains where the extension is more than three characters long (eg.&lt;br/&gt;
.info) then the client-side javascript generated by commons-validator 1.1.4&lt;br/&gt;
complains about an invalid e-mail address.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;

        <key id="12342530">VALIDATOR-4</key>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-3] [Validator] Search the locale &apos;hierarchy&apos; of formsets for a Form</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-3</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Currently if a formset for a specific locale is specified, but a form is not &lt;br/&gt;
found in that formset then Validator doesn&apos;t currently check less specific &lt;br/&gt;
formsets.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For Example, given the following config...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;formset language=&quot;fr&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;form name=&quot;myForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        ...&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;form name=&quot;otherForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        ...&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;/formset&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;   &amp;lt;formset language=&quot;fr&quot; country=&quot;CA&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;form name=&quot;otherForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
        ...&lt;br/&gt;
      &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;/formset&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/form-validation&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;... then calling ValidatorResources&apos;s getForm() method with a locale of &lt;br/&gt;
Locale.CANADA_FRENCH and form name of &quot;myForm&quot; returns null - rather than &lt;br/&gt;
returning the form named &quot;myForm&quot; defined in the &amp;lt;formset language=&quot;fr&quot;&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
formset.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I found this after looking into the following question from Wolfgang Gehner...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;I have a question though. If I don&apos;t use the language parameter on the formset &lt;br/&gt;
(which is what you suggested), as in language=&quot;fr&quot;, it will tell me that &lt;br/&gt;
formset for locale &quot;fr&quot; is not found. Do you think I am doing something wrong?&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342667">VALIDATOR-3</key>
            <summary>[Validator] Search the locale &apos;hierarchy&apos; of formsets for a Form</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="niallp">Niall Pemberton</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 1 Nov 2005 00:09:52 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-2] GenericValidator.isEmail() fails for address &quot;toto@web.d-&quot;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-2</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;toto@web.d- should not be accepted as a valid email address but the&lt;br/&gt;
validator returns true.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341100">VALIDATOR-2</key>
            <summary>GenericValidator.isEmail() fails for address &quot;toto@web.d-&quot;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="mguillemot@yahoo.fr">Marc Guillemot</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

                            <comment id="12405478" author="husted@apache.org" created="Mon, 3 May 2004 07:47:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I believe that checking for each possible .cn domain is outside the scope of &lt;br/&gt;
this validator. I&apos;ll update the Javadoc to note the limitation. Should you &lt;br/&gt;
need to extend the email validator so that all of the country domains are &lt;br/&gt;
checked, please give us the opportunity to consider the patch. I might suggest &lt;br/&gt;
making a country domain validator a second validator dependant on the original &lt;br/&gt;
validator. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-1] [validator] Float validator can&apos;t validate the string with several dot</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-1</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Now I use the sturts validator to assure a form member be a float. When I input &lt;br/&gt;
1.2.0.2 into a text which must be a float, the javascript that created by &lt;br/&gt;
struts won&apos;t work, and value of the form member will be 0.0&lt;br/&gt;
I don&apos;t know why. If i input other charactors(not digital or dot), the &lt;br/&gt;
javascript works , and popup a windows alert.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows 2000&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341884">VALIDATOR-1</key>
            <summary>[validator] Float validator can&apos;t validate the string with several dot</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gxsheng@televigation.cn">grinner</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 23 Nov 2004 10:33:47 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:24:54 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12408096" author="martinc" created="Wed, 29 Dec 2004 14:03:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This looks like a Commons Validator bug to me. The validateFloat() function &lt;br/&gt;
splits the value on &apos;.&apos;, but doesn&apos;t check the size of the resulting array &lt;br/&gt;
before going on to validate that the remaining characters are digits. As with &lt;br/&gt;
other JavaScript functions, parseFloat() doesn&apos;t error out when it reaches &lt;br/&gt;
something invalid, it just stops parsing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The fix would be to check for &quot;tempArray.length &amp;gt; 2&quot; and error out in that &lt;br/&gt;
situation, since, for example, &quot;1.2.0.2&quot; would result in tempArray.length == 4, &lt;br/&gt;
which is clearly invalid.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12408097" author="mac@apache.org" created="Wed, 29 Dec 2004 18:07:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=13853)&lt;br/&gt;
Patch solving improper float validation as suggested by Martin&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This patch solves this issue but client side validation is still (very) exposed&lt;br/&gt;
to bugs. In &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-168&quot; title=&quot;[validator] Extension to provide test cases for client-side validation&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-168&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-1813&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; I propose a way to have simpler validators and test&lt;br/&gt;
cases which (ideally) wouldn&apos;t let these bugs out. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12408098" author="mrdon" created="Mon, 15 Aug 2005 04:54:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed.  Thanks for the patch!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                            <attachment id="12333253" name="ASF.LICENSE.NOT.GRANTED--float.txt" size="793" author="mac@apache.org" created="Wed, 29 Dec 2004 18:07:28 +0000"/>
                    </attachments>
